commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/805001
Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: I41a6fe11e8ab39a60b19299da18ee085a10dc202

subject: Accept a string value for enabled_share_backends
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-07-15 00:19:14.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/manila_backends_spec.rb', 'manifests/backends.pp'], 'message': "Accept a string value for enabled_share_backends

Currently using a string value for the enabled_share_backends parameter
causes the following error, which is not quite clear for users.
~~~
Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, 'join'
parameter 'arg' expects an Array value, got String ...
~~~

This change allows usage of a single string value, as is done for
the other ListOpts, because there is no logic which actually requires
an array value.

Change-Id: I786e5d477131fa60502a9985f0db4b19f418ce9b
"}]
commit_message:
Accept a string value for enabled_share_backends

Currently using a string value for the enabled_share_backends parameter
causes the following error, which is not quite clear for users.
~~~
Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, 'join'
parameter 'arg' expects an Array value, got String ...
~~~

This change allows usage of a single string value, as is done for
the other ListOpts, because there is no logic which actually requires
an array value.

Change-Id: I786e5d477131fa60502a9985f0db4b19f418ce9b

subject: lvm: Deprecate driver_handles_share_servers
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-07-15 12:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/deprecate-lvm-driver_handles_share_servers-f3fd2b4b69e66ac5.yaml', 'spec/defines/manila_backend_lvm_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/lvm.pp'], 'message': 'lvm: Deprecate driver_handles_share_servers

The manila-share service requires that the driver_handles_share_servers
parameter is configured for all backends and the service fails to start
if the parameter is missing.

Because lvm driver supports only driver_handles_share_servers=False,
this change makes the parameter hard-coded instead of requiring users
to set the parameter correctly.

Change-Id: Idc9dee01e66cc3b72ae441aa150281f7313f14f4
'}]
commit_message:
lvm: Deprecate driver_handles_share_servers

The manila-share service requires that the driver_handles_share_servers
parameter is configured for all backends and the service fails to start
if the parameter is missing.

Because lvm driver supports only driver_handles_share_servers=False,
this change makes the parameter hard-coded instead of requiring users
to set the parameter correctly.

Change-Id: Idc9dee01e66cc3b72ae441aa150281f7313f14f4

commit_message:
Remove the note of training-labs

Training-labs had been officially retired as no maintainer.
The information of training-labs has been deleting in the openstack
documentatioan. It is not appropriate to continue the presentation in
note form here.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-October/025586.html
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/e78d74f10558ab3e6a9a6fd7d45e617c15e9c3d8

subject: update neutron-linuxbridge-tempest for bug 1980948
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-15 15:40:00.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/tempest-singlenode.yaml'], 'message': 'update neutron-linuxbridge-tempest for bug 1980948

change Ib18efa3f472736b58c8967847b1061da0e3897d7
made linuxbridge an experimental feature but
it did not enable linuxbridge in the linuxbridge jobs

this job is used by both nova and devstack and perhaps
other project on an as needed basis. As a result
this is causing gate failures in neutron when some files
are modifed such as the netwroking module or vif.py files

This change enabled linux brdige in the base linux bridge
job and removes an old duplicate job defintion since
nova and devstack now use the new name.

Change-Id: I290027fbac47bd1df7bcdd08c405db107ed63db0
Closes-Bug: #1980948
'}]
commit_message:
update neutron-linuxbridge-tempest for bug 1980948

change Ib18efa3f472736b58c8967847b1061da0e3897d7
made linuxbridge an experimental feature but
it did not enable linuxbridge in the linuxbridge jobs

this job is used by both nova and devstack and perhaps
other project on an as needed basis. As a result
this is causing gate failures in neutron when some files
are modifed such as the netwroking module or vif.py files

This change enabled linux brdige in the base linux bridge
job and removes an old duplicate job defintion since
nova and devstack now use the new name.

Change-Id: I290027fbac47bd1df7bcdd08c405db107ed63db0
Closes-Bug: #1980948

commit_message:
Allow unknown attributes in project resources

Keystone allows setting custom properties in the project resources. This
patch enables interacting with this functionality by enabling
_allow_unknown_attrs_in_body.

Change-Id: I414c68cf0deebd7936bd548a737971dbc44857d3

commit_message:

uses the original_name attribute instead.

This also adds a note to explain why we need ceph in that scenario so
that we can easily understand that is actually required.

commit_message:
NVMe-oF: Remove misleading exception from logs

When disconnecting a non-replicated volume that uses the newer
connection properties format we'll get some exception trace logs that
could make us think that something went wrong, when in reality this is
ok.

Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: DEBUG oslo.privsep.daemon [-] privsep: Exception during request[95eb2bcc-e4eb-4f5b-b823-56fd7aa338c6]: Unexpected error while running command.
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Command: blkid /dev/nvme0n2 -s TYPE -o value
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Exit code: 2
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Stdout: ''
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Stderr: '' {{(pid=988326) _process_cmd /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_privsep/daemon.py:481}}
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Traceback (most recent call last):
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_privsep/daemon.py", line 476, in _process_cmd
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:     ret = func(*f_args, **f_kwargs)
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_privsep/priv_context.py", line 274, in _wrap
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:     return func(*args, **kwargs)
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:   File "/opt/remote_brick/os_brick/privileged/rootwrap.py", line 197, in execute_root
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:     return custom_execute(*cmd, shell=False, run_as_root=False, **kwargs)
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:   File "/opt/remote_brick/os_brick/privileged/rootwrap.py", line 146, in custom_execute
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:     on_completion=on_completion, *cmd, **kwargs)
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/processutils.py", line 441, in execute
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]:     cmd=sanitized_cmd)
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: oslo_concurrency.processutils.ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Command: blkid /dev/nvme0n2 -s TYPE -o value
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Exit code: 2
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Stdout: ''
Mar 09 11:14:42 localhost.localdomain nova-compute[988198]: Stderr: ''

This patch calls the command execution in a way that no longer shows
such exception.

Closes-Bug: #1964389
Change-Id: I1c54e1ff3026cffe49b303f01e43d1b90d0bf3bc

Training-labs had been officially retired as no maintainer.
The information of training-labs has been deleting in the openstack
documentatioan. It is not appropriate to continue the presentation in
note form here.

commit_message:
Delete system role assignments from system_assignment table

This patch ensures to delete the system role assignments from
all the assignment tables in keystone after deleting the role
user has over the system.

This also make sure of deleting stale role assignments before
deleting role for the deployments that are already in this state.

Closes-Bug: #1878938

Change-Id: I4df19c45c870ff3fb78578ca1fb7dd0d35da3c82
(cherry picked from commit c1dcbb05b4488f1fa3e7af4d9171d11702d94119)

subject: Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 9954, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'username': 'lbragstad', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 16465, 'name': 'Kristi Nikolla', 'email': 'knikolla@bu.edu', 'username': 'knikolla'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 32291, 'name': 'wushiming', 'email': 'wushiming@yovole.com', 'username': 'wushiming'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2020-11-11 16:49:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/identity/backends/test_ldap_common.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1889936-78d6853b5212b8f1.yaml'], 'message': "Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

If LDAP returns a UUID as an octet string the LDAP driver will fail to
convert it to something meaningful. The error usually looks something
like:

  ID attribute objectGUID not found in LDAP object

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py

      Due to python2 -> python3 migration code.

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)
(cherry picked from commit d5870f69c12c034dd97b164345e85e6259ee7abe)
(cherry picked from commit a0b6560364046a9466ff995a6c180a6edcd659fb)
(cherry picked from commit 2d92178b72832f8259c436b60cffe812074ff46b)
"}]
commit_message:
Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

If LDAP returns a UUID as an octet string the LDAP driver will fail to
convert it to something meaningful. The error usually looks something
like:

  ID attribute objectGUID not found in LDAP object

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py

      Due to python2 -> python3 migration code.

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)
(cherry picked from commit d5870f69c12c034dd97b164345e85e6259ee7abe)
(cherry picked from commit a0b6560364046a9466ff995a6c180a6edcd659fb)
(cherry picked from commit 2d92178b72832f8259c436b60cffe812074ff46b)

subject: [queens-only] Ensure catalog is present in token validation response
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-28 16:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py'], 'message': '[queens-only] Ensure catalog is present in token validation response

unless explicitly asked otherwise.

In Queens, token caching includes service catalog also.

If token was created with `?nocatalog`, it will be cached w/o catalog,
and on token validation response will return token infoa also w/o catalog
until cache is invalidated.

Such catalog-less tokens break other services (e.g. Nova) as they rely
on catalog being present in the results of token validation returned
by keystonemiddleware.

Change-Id: Iaac49cd66fdaa2871b8c012b1c5c8685cb6453a8
Closes-Bug: #1938323
'}]
commit_message:
[queens-only] Ensure catalog is present in token validation response

unless explicitly asked otherwise.

In Queens, token caching includes service catalog also.

If token was created with `?nocatalog`, it will be cached w/o catalog,
and on token validation response will return token infoa also w/o catalog
until cache is invalidated.

Such catalog-less tokens break other services (e.g. Nova) as they rely
on catalog being present in the results of token validation returned
by keystonemiddleware.

Change-Id: Iaac49cd66fdaa2871b8c012b1c5c8685cb6453a8
Closes-Bug: #1938323

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2020-11-11 16:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/identity/backends/test_ldap_common.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1889936-78d6853b5212b8f1.yaml'], 'message': "Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

If LDAP returns a UUID as an octet string the LDAP driver will fail to
convert it to something meaningful. The error usually looks something
like:

  ID attribute objectGUID not found in LDAP object

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py

      Due to python2 -> python3 migration code.

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)

"}]
commit_message:
Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

If LDAP returns a UUID as an octet string the LDAP driver will fail to
convert it to something meaningful. The error usually looks something
like:

  ID attribute objectGUID not found in LDAP object

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py

      Due to python2 -> python3 migration code.

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)
(cherry picked from commit d5870f69c12c034dd97b164345e85e6259ee7abe)
(cherry picked from commit a0b6560364046a9466ff995a6c180a6edcd659fb)

commit_message:
Hide AccountLocked exception from end users

This change hides the AccountLocked exception from being returned
to the end user to hide sensitive information that a potential
malicious person could gain insight from.

The notification handler catches the AccountLocked exception as
before, but after sending the audit notification, it instead
bubbles up Unauthorized rather than AccountLocked.

Conflicts:
  keystone/tests/unit/identity/test_backend_sql.py

Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samueldmq@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id51241989b22c52810391f3e8e1cadbf8613d873
Related-Bug: #1688137

`federation_group_ids` could be zero length list, so deciding whether
a token is federated by checking if it is none.

commit_message:

This change hides the AccountLocked exception from being returned
to the end user to hide sensitive information that a potential
malicious person could gain insight from.

The notification handler catches the AccountLocked exception as
before, but after sending the audit notification, it instead
bubbles up Unauthorized rather than AccountLocked.

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: I1a4ea772cc0e0b2359499d827c24a6870121cd42

subject: Keystone Kerberos works well when you openstack client can dialog with yours KDC.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}, {'_account_id': 14250, 'name': 'Grzegorz Grasza', 'email': 'xek@redhat.com', 'username': 'xek'}, {'_account_id': 16465, 'name': 'Kristi Nikolla', 'email': 'knikolla@bu.edu', 'username': 'knikolla'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 34164, 'name': 'DELBARY Gael', 'email': 'gael.delbary@cea.fr'}, {'_account_id': 34165, 'name': 'Sacha Pateyron', 'email': 'sacha.pateyron@cea.fr', 'username': 'sachapateyron'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-20 12:34:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/plugins/external.py'], 'message': 'Keystone Kerberos works well when you openstack client
can dialog with yours KDC.

However when KDC is hidden, it's not accessible by our
users directly so we need to delegate the auth Kerberos
to HTTP to get Keystone token, that's why we use curl command.

From the Openstack client cli we get "Negotiate"
as auth_type -> it's works. Nonetheless with curl we get "Basic"
as auth_type -> raised error.

That's why we proposed to add "Basic" as authorized method for Kerberos.

Change-Id: I7fb63117c5e0b6cd4665e00c530f0b27dfcc8c79
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone Kerberos works well when you openstack client
can dialog with yours KDC.

However when KDC is hidden, it's not accessible by our
users directly so we need to delegate the auth Kerberos
to HTTP to get Keystone token, that's why we use curl command.

From the Openstack client cli we get "Negotiate"
as auth_type -> it's works. Nonetheless with curl we get "Basic"
as auth_type -> raised error.

That's why we proposed to add "Basic" as authorized method for Kerberos.

Change-Id: I7fb63117c5e0b6cd4665e00c530f0b27dfcc8c79

subject: Also record last_active_at for local users using IdP to log in
revisions:

If a user tries to log in after disable_user_account_days_inactive days,
the login is denied with 401, the log showing a "User is disabled".

Before this changeset, local users using an federated identity for login
did not get an updated last_active_at. Hence the login was denied 90
after account setup.

Change-Id: I7dd0db1135898c4098093f54d759ff2384bf7714
(cherry-picked from commit c0852384d65030ac62c44e3a70a4db2b8184585f)
'}]
commit_message:
Also record last_active_at for local users using IdP to log in

If a user tries to log in after disable_user_account_days_inactive days,
the login is denied with 401, the log showing a "User is disabled".

Before this changeset, local users using an federated identity for login
did not get an updated last_active_at. Hence the login was denied 90
after account setup.

Change-Id: I7dd0db1135898c4098093f54d759ff2384bf7714
(cherry-picked from commit c0852384d65030ac62c44e3a70a4db2b8184585f)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-01 13:09:12.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/utils.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/boot.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/irmc/boot.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/boot.py'], 'message': "Fix prepare ramdisk for 'wait' states

handling when it needs another reboot. Without this change

This unifies all occurrences and create utility method for
reuse. All occurrences are aligned to have the same set of

 Conflicts:
       ironic/drivers/utils.py

Change-Id: I685c5827a70df4abb358635d89b86894671ac493
(cherry picked from commit dd1cb46f2b0146524f0cb4d3579ac5c5b9a6fa45)

commit_message:
Fix prepare ramdisk for 'wait' states

Node can be in CLEANWAIT or DEPLOYWAIT during async step
handling when it needs another reboot. Without this change
node fails to boot back to IPA.

This unifies all occurrences and create utility method for
reuse. All occurrences are aligned to have the same set of
states in case they are needed in future.

 Conflicts:
       ironic/drivers/utils.py

Change-Id: I685c5827a70df4abb358635d89b86894671ac493
(cherry picked from commit dd1cb46f2b0146524f0cb4d3579ac5c5b9a6fa45)

commit_message:
Format json output properly

str(dict) or print(dict) format a dict value into an invalid json
string because it uses single quotes(') instead of double quotes(").

This also fixes the log messages which mentions 'JSON' but doesn't
convert a dict value to a valid json string.

Conflicts:
	os_net_config/cli.py

Resolved conflict caused by da3bd5fbb8818743b96d7975f81907ed07409688 .

Closes-Bug: #1973566
Change-Id: I2398e3881310746f349e2c9a89c64956efbc13b2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-15 07:08:39.000000000', 'files': ['roles/build-test-packages/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Allow to define artg_change_list variable in zuul jobs

Previously, artg_change_list in role build-test-packages would default
to an empty list if not defined. Now, artg_change_list will default to
job.artg_change_list which itself defaults to empty list. This allows
us to specify variable artg_change_list in Zuul jobs. If role
build-test-packages is executed locally, then a locally defined
artg_change_list still has higher precedence, as expected.

Previously, if a change had e.g. a 'Depends-On:' statement in its
commit message, the artg_change_list variable would be overwritten
with patches defined in the 'Depends-On:' statements. Now, patches
listed in 'Depends-On:' will be added to the artg_change_list
variable instead of overwriting its contents.

Both functionality is required in our TripleO jobs in the Ansible
OpenStack collection. There we want to build the RPM of
openstacksdk from its upstream master branch instead of using the
pinned version provided by RDO [1].

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdoinfo/blob/f482a6ecc45910cb6ccae448bffecfac0a6999c8/tags/zed-uc.yml#L467

Change-Id: If44fe00bda10faa61df1dff9dc6da2ea26aa6b59
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to define artg_change_list variable in zuul jobs

Previously, artg_change_list in role build-test-packages would default
to an empty list if not defined. Now, artg_change_list will default to
job.artg_change_list which itself defaults to empty list. This allows
us to specify variable artg_change_list in Zuul jobs. If role
build-test-packages is executed locally, then a locally defined
artg_change_list still has higher precedence, as expected.

Previously, if a change had e.g. a 'Depends-On:' statement in its
commit message, the artg_change_list variable would be overwritten
with patches defined in the 'Depends-On:' statements. Now, patches
listed in 'Depends-On:' will be added to the artg_change_list
variable instead of overwriting its contents.

Both functionality is required in our TripleO jobs in the Ansible
OpenStack collection. There we want to build the RPM of
openstacksdk from its upstream master branch instead of using the
pinned version provided by RDO [1].

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdoinfo/blob/f482a6ecc45910cb6ccae448bffecfac0a6999c8/tags/zed-uc.yml#L467

Change-Id: If44fe00bda10faa61df1dff9dc6da2ea26aa6b59

commit_message:
Reduce the usage of no_log in keystone code

Ansible is smart enough not to log auth and password fields. Using
no_log makes debugging of the tasks impossible.

Change-Id: I8c3fbc39866a20dcb48572b4b7a24196873d7832

revisions:

some of Nova API policies allow to use user_id in the policy rule
definitions.

This patch allows to use 'user_id:%(user_id)s' check (and the like)
in the api access policy for getting URLs for remote consoles.

Thus it is now possibe to limit access to remote cosoles to e.g.
only the user that created the instance.

Change-Id: I5ba02c6f1db670b7d4450efcd91d6f502ebd0924
"}]
commit_message:
Support user_id in policy for remote consoles

some of Nova API policies allow to use user_id in the policy rule
definitions.

This patch allows to use 'user_id:%(user_id)s' check (and the like)
in the api access policy for getting URLs for remote consoles.

Thus it is now possibe to limit access to remote cosoles to e.g.
only the user that created the instance.

Change-Id: I5ba02c6f1db670b7d4450efcd91d6f502ebd0924

The validation of dhcp-provisioning fails because it doesn't see

so the ansible_env.HOME is the home directory of root.

commit_message:
Fix to get HOME environment in dhcp-provisioning validation

The validation of dhcp-provisioning fails because it doesn't see
the correct path of undercloud.conf. The playbook has "become: true",
so the ansible_env.HOME is the home directory of root.

lookup(env, HOME) can get the home directory for the user.

Change-Id: I7c7de26f09f36d88b777be76027ad4ac66deda6b
(cherry picked from commit 8e4958cd7575c8c42da02976b4fad1e4f30924c7)

commit_message:
[TripleO-Package] Remove Dockerfiles

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839319
recommends use of default config_podman.yml config for podman driver
and removes the dockerfiles.

These are the leftover dockerfiles of tripleo-packages role.
This patch removes the same.

By using the same hostname, it fixes issue with the
tripleo_packages mol job
```
msg: 'Failed to connect to the host via ssh: ssh: Could not resolve hostname centos: Name or service not known'
```

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2a7c76a82a4575e45cb0fc5031d8fe72858a7e6b
(cherry picked from commit bb2a5b1a800ba2ad91b32d2991154b34ee5575b0)

commit_message:
Remove ineffective ovn_remote_probe_interval

This parameter was introduced to puppet-neutron but it was completely
wrong and the actual parameter has never been implemented in neutron.

The interval should be configured in ovn controller, and this is
already implemented using puppet-ovn.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/848997
Change-Id: I53fd5c4795b3f27c58d7731d4b6f43dc45c11092
(cherry picked from commit 439eb262c8aea99f6d0a1c3c2ec6a557404ee929)

commit_message:
Configure OVN sb connections for the OVN provider

The OVN provider requires connections to the OVN sb db in order to
receive events for associating FIP/VIPs and healthchecks.

Note: also adds the driver agent mounts to the driver agent container.
SSL functionality would be otherwise broken.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/849414
Change-Id: I3f16ffc754bf468f95711a7ec69fc95e2f370687

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2022-05-06 20:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['manila/api/v1/security_service.py', 'manila/tests/api/v1/test_security_service.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1916102-fix-security-service-policy-check-8e72254fa9fedc9e.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove admin context check, update unit tests

In manila/api/v1/security_service.py, the context.is_admin check is
removed, allowing the subsequent policy check to determine whether the
user can retrieve all security services. Authorization is determined by
the RBAC policy "security_services:get_all_security_services".

In manila/tests/api/v1/test_security_service.py, unit tests for listing
security services based on admin context were replaced with unit tests
for listing security services based on whether the user is authorized or
not.

The unit test test_security_services_list_all_tenants_policy_authorized
asserts that the security services are retrieved when
policy.check_policy returns True.

The unit test
test_security_services_list_all_tenants_policy_not_authorized asserts
that security services are not retrieved when policy.check_policy
raises a NotAuthorized exception.

Closes-Bug: #1916102

Change-Id: I6cce61237f5ee3ce60d8165f6fac5e7e5a63b4dd
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/840727
'}]
commit_message:
Remove admin context check, update unit tests

In manila/api/v1/security_service.py, the context.is_admin check is
removed, allowing the subsequent policy check to determine whether the
user can retrieve all security services. Authorization is determined by
the RBAC policy "security_services:get_all_security_services".

In manila/tests/api/v1/test_security_service.py, unit tests for listing
security services based on admin context were replaced with unit tests
for listing security services based on whether the user is authorized or
not.

The unit test test_security_services_list_all_tenants_policy_authorized
asserts that the security services are retrieved when
policy.check_policy returns True.

The unit test
test_security_services_list_all_tenants_policy_not_authorized asserts
that security services are not retrieved when policy.check_policy
raises a NotAuthorized exception.

Closes-Bug: #1916102

Change-Id: I6cce61237f5ee3ce60d8165f6fac5e7e5a63b4dd
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/840727

subject: Modify security service list test
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30002, 'name': 'Douglas Viroel', 'email': 'viroel@gmail.com', 'username': 'dviroel'}, {'_account_id': 30025, 'name': 'Vida Haririan', 'display_name': 'Vida Haririan', 'email': 'vhariria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vhari'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-05-06 20:19:27.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_security_services.py'], 'message': "Modify security service list test

Since we decoupled ``share:get_all_security_services`` from
``context_is_admin``, we started preventing non-admins to use
the ``all_tenants`` flag for security service listing.

This change enhances one of our tests to ensure that in a
query to list security services using ``all_tenants``,
less-privileged users won't be able to see more security
services than they should.

Related-Bug: #1916102
Change-Id: Idd49e22c8dc534a1fe1e4814f233b079cf14bb72
"}]
commit_message:
Modify security service list test

Since we decoupled ``share:get_all_security_services`` from
``context_is_admin``, we started preventing non-admins to use
the ``all_tenants`` flag for security service listing.

This change enhances one of our tests to ensure that in a
query to list security services using ``all_tenants``,
less-privileged users won't be able to see more security
services than they should.

Related-Bug: #1916102
Change-Id: Idd49e22c8dc534a1fe1e4814f233b079cf14bb72

commit_message:
Zed-2 Release for ovsdbapp

This is the Zed milestone-2 release for ovsdbapp.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If you are happy with the current release hash, please +1 this patch
and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new
commit hash to use once it is ready.

If a release is definitely not wanted at this time, please -1 and
leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

Any patches with no response will be assumed to be OK and will be
processed by July 14th.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I11763c077eb531d91260e97e3cc809e34a34b207

subject: libvirt: remove default cputune shares value
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-07-14 15:55:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-default-cputune-shares-values-85d5ddf4b8e24eaa.yaml', 'nova/virt/libvirt/migration.py', 'doc/source/admin/resource-limits.rst', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: remove default cputune shares value

Previously, the libvirt driver defaulted to 1024 * (# of CPUs) for the
value of domain/cputune/shares in the libvirt XML. This value is then
passed directly by libvirt to the cgroups API. Cgroups v2 imposes a
maximum value of 10000 that can be passed in. This makes Nova
unable to launch instances with more than 9 CPUs on hosts that run
cgroups v2, like Ubuntu Jammy or RHEL 9.

Fix this by just removing the default entirely. Because there is no
longer a guarantee that domain/cputune will contain at least a shares
element, we can stop always generating the former, and only generate
it if it will actually contain something.

We can also make operators's lives easier by leveraging the fact that
we update the XML during live migration, so this patch also adds a
method to remove the shares value from the live migration XML if one
was not set as the quota:cpu_shares flavor extra spec.

For operators that *have* set this extra spec to something greater
than 10000, their flavors will have to get updates, and their
instances resized.

Partial-bug: 1978489
Change-Id: I49d757f5f261b3562ada27e6cf57284f615ca395
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: remove default cputune shares value

Previously, the libvirt driver defaulted to 1024 * (# of CPUs) for the
value of domain/cputune/shares in the libvirt XML. This value is then
passed directly by libvirt to the cgroups API. Cgroups v2 imposes a
maximum value of 10000 that can be passed in. This makes Nova
unable to launch instances with more than 9 CPUs on hosts that run
cgroups v2, like Ubuntu Jammy or RHEL 9.

Fix this by just removing the default entirely. Because there is no
longer a guarantee that domain/cputune will contain at least a shares
element, we can stop always generating the former, and only generate
it if it will actually contain something.

We can also make operators's lives easier by leveraging the fact that
we update the XML during live migration, so this patch also adds a
method to remove the shares value from the live migration XML if one
was not set as the quota:cpu_shares flavor extra spec.

For operators that *have* set this extra spec to something greater
than 10000, their flavors will have to get updates, and their
instances resized.

Partial-bug: 1978489
Change-Id: I49d757f5f261b3562ada27e6cf57284f615ca395

commit_message:
Add support for log offloading over TCP

Add new OctaviaLogOffloadProtocol setting that allows to select either
UDP (default) or TCP as protocol for log offloading.

commit_message:
Use default config_podman.yml config for podman driver

By following the footprint of
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839685
to use default config for delegated driver.

It adds the default podman config and reuse the same in all
roles where CentOS8 image is used for testing.

Note: It is not a clean cherry-pick. It fixes ceph molecule
jobs.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3e6dba0539b9622433ce74e18b5fbdc05e5bcaaf
(cherry picked from commit d95784efa53cc4badf650061da7045b4b34f5229)

subject: Consume BGP service plugin queue in RPC workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 11:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_dynamic_routing/services/bgp/bgp_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Consume BGP service plugin queue in RPC workers

This patch adds BGP service plugin RPC queue to RPC workers, like it is
done in other Neutron service plugins (l3-plugin, metering, etc.).
Without it some RPC requests and AMQP heartbeats are not processed in
time, causing AMQP connection dropping, and other unpredictable unwanted
behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1974057
Change-Id: I1b13f01ca47c8390f1361e01d5eb313fe2fc417f
(cherry picked from commit b9c085b85f3f2912d77050a33667f88b8edd6ca0)
'}]
commit_message:
Consume BGP service plugin queue in RPC workers

This patch adds BGP service plugin RPC queue to RPC workers, like it is
done in other Neutron service plugins (l3-plugin, metering, etc.).
Without it some RPC requests and AMQP heartbeats are not processed in
time, causing AMQP connection dropping, and other unpredictable unwanted
behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1974057
Change-Id: I1b13f01ca47c8390f1361e01d5eb313fe2fc417f
(cherry picked from commit b9c085b85f3f2912d77050a33667f88b8edd6ca0)

subject: db: Don't use strings to indicate column, relationship paths
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-06-16 13:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/fixtures.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "db: Don't use strings to indicate column, relationship paths

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  Using strings to indicate column or relationship paths in loader
  options is deprecated and will be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0.  Please
  use the class-bound attribute directly.

This is a rather chunky patch, but each change is very similar so it
should be easy to grok.

Change-Id: Iaa1d7595d190b4ee4e3fd06608424b6d027b3303
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Don't use strings to indicate column, relationship paths

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  Using strings to indicate column or relationship paths in loader
  options is deprecated and will be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0.  Please
  use the class-bound attribute directly.

This is a rather chunky patch, but each change is very similar so it
should be easy to grok.

Change-Id: Iaa1d7595d190b4ee4e3fd06608424b6d027b3303
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Rename base-upstream.yaml to base.yaml

Due to Zuul Job reparenting work, base-upstream.yaml file is created
to keep the new zuul job base there.
Since Zuul job reparenting work is done, it's time to drop old
base.yaml and rename base-upstream.yaml to base.yaml.

base.yaml is dropped in this review:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/849856/

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I08afc3e69059c7bc066eeec0a40ce4cd50d3cc7f

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iffd7b0eaebe4a72cf12f4ff159936005f1c13584

subject: Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-15 06:18:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py'], 'message': "Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Conflicts:
	heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py

Fixed conflicts caused by 74164424016702bac6d52c6618360287ce7ea461 ,
which is present in stable/xena and later.

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039

commit_message:
Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Conflicts:
	heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py

Fixed conflicts caused by 74164424016702bac6d52c6618360287ce7ea461 ,
which is present in stable/xena and later.

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)
(cherry picked from commit f9f5d2cc368e5f850b962c8d89669a50544058d1)

during Wallaby cycle[2].

[2] 5cbc2b8ef154b269bad8491e7d469c6094514335

commit_message:
Add logextractor tool

The tool will make a query to the Opensearch to receive a message,
parse it and send to to another index.

Change-Id: I96bb271977c728c14b2aeae73605c440f85e2a50

subject: Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-14 14:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py'], 'message': "Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)
(cherry picked from commit f9f5d2cc368e5f850b962c8d89669a50544058d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)
(cherry picked from commit f9f5d2cc368e5f850b962c8d89669a50544058d1)

subject: Set sensible nf_conntrack_max value in amphora
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-24 08:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/templates/amphora-netns.systemd.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-nf-conntrack-max-value-in-amp-0e16eb50b42e7b58.yaml'], 'message': 'Set sensible nf_conntrack_max value in amphora

This sets the values of nf_conntrack_max and nf_conntrack_expect_max to
sensible values. Previously, the default values set by the kernel were
used, which limited net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_max to 32768. On the
other hand, Octavia sets nf_conntrack_buckets to 125000. A value of
nf_conntrack_max lower than half of that makes no sense.

The new values are calculated using the formula for the default value
in the kernel [1]:

nf_conntrack_max = nf_conntrack_buckets
nf_conntrack_expect_max = nf_conntrack_buckets / 256

[1]: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/nf_conntrack-sysctl.rst

Story: 2010050
Task: 45460
Change-Id: Id1dd029995d41e6913a07eeb120c889d71d583eb
(cherry picked from commit 3d3e38afe9f0186f45e9800090afecc3aa434846)
(cherry picked from commit 78603681cce95048b76e2fcfabcdb0b5baf58c51)
(cherry picked from commit 33eaff55fc59c711e9a74dd94f55d84a54f09f56)
(cherry picked from commit d0adca9a34b5d2f36b821478d4e505f6592f222a)
'}]
commit_message:
Set sensible nf_conntrack_max value in amphora

This sets the values of nf_conntrack_max and nf_conntrack_expect_max to
sensible values. Previously, the default values set by the kernel were
used, which limited net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_max to 32768. On the
other hand, Octavia sets nf_conntrack_buckets to 125000. A value of
nf_conntrack_max lower than half of that makes no sense.

The new values are calculated using the formula for the default value
in the kernel [1]:

nf_conntrack_max = nf_conntrack_buckets
nf_conntrack_expect_max = nf_conntrack_buckets / 256

[1]: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/nf_conntrack-sysctl.rst

Story: 2010050
Task: 45460
Change-Id: Id1dd029995d41e6913a07eeb120c889d71d583eb
(cherry picked from commit 3d3e38afe9f0186f45e9800090afecc3aa434846)
(cherry picked from commit 78603681cce95048b76e2fcfabcdb0b5baf58c51)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-06-16 03:31:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/versions.py', 'ironic/conductor/allocations.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_allocations.py', 'ironic/common/release_mappings.py', 'releasenotes/notes/allocation-node-name-46b473ec82662f7f.yaml', 'api-ref/source/baremetal-api-v1-allocation.inc'], 'message': "Allocation candidates prefer matching name

This change finds a node with the same name as the allocation and
moves it to the beginning of the shuffled candidate list so that node
is the first allocation attempt.

It is common for node naming scheme to match the node's role (such as
compute-1, compute-2). Also this often matches the hostname
(allocation name) scheme. Without this change, this scenario will
generally result in swapped names (node compute-1 having hostname
compute-2, etc).

By preferring matching names this situation can be avoided in the
majority of cases, while not otherwise affecting the candidiate
allocation approach.

Change-Id: Ie990bfc209959d58852b9080778602eab5aa30af
"}]
commit_message:
Allocation candidates prefer matching name

This change finds a node with the same name as the allocation and
moves it to the beginning of the shuffled candidate list so that node
is the first allocation attempt.

It is common for node naming scheme to match the node's role (such as
compute-1, compute-2). Also this often matches the hostname
(allocation name) scheme. Without this change, this scenario will
generally result in swapped names (node compute-1 having hostname
compute-2, etc).

By preferring matching names this situation can be avoided in the
majority of cases, while not otherwise affecting the candidiate
allocation approach.

Change-Id: Ie990bfc209959d58852b9080778602eab5aa30af

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-01 12:44:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/utils.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/boot.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/irmc/boot.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/boot.py'], 'message': "Fix prepare ramdisk for 'wait' states

Node can be in CLEANWAIT or DEPLOYWAIT during async step
handling when it needs another reboot. Without this change
node fails to boot back to IPA.

This unifies all occurrences and create utility method for
reuse. All occurrences are aligned to have the same set of
states in case they are needed in future.

Change-Id: I685c5827a70df4abb358635d89b86894671ac493
(cherry picked from commit dd1cb46f2b0146524f0cb4d3579ac5c5b9a6fa45)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix prepare ramdisk for 'wait' states

Node can be in CLEANWAIT or DEPLOYWAIT during async step
handling when it needs another reboot. Without this change
node fails to boot back to IPA.

This unifies all occurrences and create utility method for
reuse. All occurrences are aligned to have the same set of
states in case they are needed in future.

Change-Id: I685c5827a70df4abb358635d89b86894671ac493
(cherry picked from commit dd1cb46f2b0146524f0cb4d3579ac5c5b9a6fa45)

subject: Minmum TTL value is zero
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 14:08:08.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/recordset.py', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_recordsets.py'], 'message': 'Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7
'}]
commit_message:
Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7

subject: Change Ansible OpenStack collection to stable/1.0.0 branch
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30002, 'name': 'Douglas Viroel', 'email': 'viroel@gmail.com', 'username': 'dviroel'}, {'_account_id': 32962, 'name': 'Jakob Meng', 'email': 'code@jakobmeng.de', 'username': 'jakobmeng@web.de'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-07-14 07:55:01.000000000', 'files': ['ansible-collection-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Change Ansible OpenStack collection to stable/1.0.0 branch

Previously, quickstart.sh installed the latest code from the master
branch of Ansible OpenStack collection. Later, TripleO would install
its own release of the Ansible OpenStack collection from RDO RPMs,
but this release would be shadowed by the quickstart.sh release,
causing compatibility issues due to wrong combinations of AOC and
OpenStack SDK.

We now install Ansible OpenStack collection from its stable/1.0.0
branch which is compatible to the RDO RPMs. Of course, this approach
will break once we want to use two separate releases depending on
the RDO branch we are in. But atm we have no other approach to
decouple the upstream git repository of AOC from TripleO
Quickstart.

We cannot drop AOC from quickstart.sh completely because e.g.
Ansible role os_tempest [1] uses openstack.cloud.* modules. If we
drop AOC, then role os_tempest fails [2] because it does not use
the AOC release that got installed from RDO RPMs even though the
path to the RPM installed collection is in ansible.cfg [3]
which is used in quickstart.sh [4].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/43963/3
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/ansible.cfg#L19
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/commit/b48d869e14de40444d69a107a0b718b5f721e912/quickstart.sh#L595

Change-Id: Id47d94d72c206bd6b61ea7a1ac9e896591d83cd6
'}]
commit_message:
Change Ansible OpenStack collection to stable/1.0.0 branch

Previously, quickstart.sh installed the latest code from the master
branch of Ansible OpenStack collection. Later, TripleO would install
its own release of the Ansible OpenStack collection from RDO RPMs,
but this release would be shadowed by the quickstart.sh release,
causing compatibility issues due to wrong combinations of AOC and
OpenStack SDK.

We now install Ansible OpenStack collection from its stable/1.0.0
branch which is compatible to the RDO RPMs. Of course, this approach
will break once we want to use two separate releases depending on
the RDO branch we are in. But atm we have no other approach to
decouple the upstream git repository of AOC from TripleO
Quickstart.

We cannot drop AOC from quickstart.sh completely because e.g.
Ansible role os_tempest [1] uses openstack.cloud.* modules. If we
drop AOC, then role os_tempest fails [2] because it does not use
the AOC release that got installed from RDO RPMs even though the
path to the RPM installed collection is in ansible.cfg [3]
which is used in quickstart.sh [4].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/43963/3
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/ansible.cfg#L19
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/commit/b48d869e14de40444d69a107a0b718b5f721e912/quickstart.sh#L595

Change-Id: Id47d94d72c206bd6b61ea7a1ac9e896591d83cd6

commit_message:
Drop Ansible OpenStack collection from job requirements

Ansible OpenStack collection is not used by TripleO Quickstart.
It is used within TripleO Ansible et al but Ansible OpenStack
collection is used via RPMs from RDO for that.

Change-Id: I551d46e612038a739c34dc6738de85344b7f1be7

Migrate charm charmhub for stable/wallaby

- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/wallaby for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests

- Build on 20.04 amd64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-07-14 14:45:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/status.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_report_client.py'], 'message': "Remove use of pkg_resources

Use of this library has significant performance implications. While
we're probably not too badly affected, we don't actually need to use it
here. The 'parse_version' utility it exposes is intended to parse
PEP440-compliant version identifiers, not the simple microversions
placement uses, which the 'microversion_parse' library can competently
parse for us.

Change-Id: I9b7281caec6fa53600dea316492d052787cf799b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove use of pkg_resources

Use of this library has significant performance implications. While
we're probably not too badly affected, we don't actually need to use it
here. The 'parse_version' utility it exposes is intended to parse
PEP440-compliant version identifiers, not the simple microversions
placement uses, which the 'microversion_parse' library can competently
parse for us.

Change-Id: I9b7281caec6fa53600dea316492d052787cf799b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Minmum TTL value is zero
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 16:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/recordset.py', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_recordsets.py'], 'message': 'Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7
'}]
commit_message:
Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7

commit_message:
Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7

subject: Changing minimum TLL filed to "0" instead of "1" according RFC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-26 11:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/zone.py'], 'message': 'Changing minimum TLL filed to "0" instead of "1" according RFC

RFC: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8
8. Time to Live (TTL)

   The definition of values appropriate to the TTL field in STD 13 is
   not as clear as it could be, with respect to how many significant
   bits exist, and whether the value is signed or unsigned.  It is
   hereby specified that a TTL value is an unsigned number, with a
   minimum value of 0, and a maximum value of 2147483647.

Change-Id: I2635a3532764bf68ac6a14eac924ab2a7d4b410a
'}]
commit_message:
Changing minimum TLL filed to "0" instead of "1" according RFC

RFC: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8
8. Time to Live (TTL)

   The definition of values appropriate to the TTL field in STD 13 is
   not as clear as it could be, with respect to how many significant
   bits exist, and whether the value is signed or unsigned.  It is
   hereby specified that a TTL value is an unsigned number, with a
   minimum value of 0, and a maximum value of 2147483647.

Change-Id: I2635a3532764bf68ac6a14eac924ab2a7d4b410a

subject: Fix bindep for EL9 platforms
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 14:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': "Fix bindep for EL9 platforms

Currently it tries to install libselinux-python and
libsemanage-python with bindep but those rpms are
only applicable to EL7 platforms.

Since we no longer support python2, let's cleanup
python2 specific rpms and use rpm names which
are applicable to all rpm distros.
python3-libselinux and python3-libsemanage should
be installable on EL7, EL8, EL9 and fedora platform.

Change-Id: I49d7d599fb6c158237de2180e2a0ff15a79b4c80
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bindep for EL9 platforms

Currently it tries to install libselinux-python and
libsemanage-python with bindep but those rpms are
only applicable to EL7 platforms.

Since we no longer support python2, let's cleanup
python2 specific rpms and use rpm names which
are applicable to all rpm distros.
python3-libselinux and python3-libsemanage should
be installable on EL7, EL8, EL9 and fedora platform.

Change-Id: I49d7d599fb6c158237de2180e2a0ff15a79b4c80

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-08 14:59:46.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ovn/ovn-metadata-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove ineffective ovn_remote_probe_interval

This parameter was introduced to puppet-neutron but it was completely
wrong and the actual parameter has never been implemented in neutron.

Also, the parameter definition in tht has never taken effect because
puppet-tripleo overrides the definition.

The interval should be configured in ovn controller, and this is
already implemented using puppet-ovn.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2105312
Change-Id: I36499dccef6ff74a288942bd0a8f0257187387e7
(cherry picked from commit c11604c1406b2c11b862bdfc3bb5d5a40831d381)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ineffective ovn_remote_probe_interval

This parameter was introduced to puppet-neutron but it was completely
wrong and the actual parameter has never been implemented in neutron.

Also, the parameter definition in tht has never taken effect because
puppet-tripleo overrides the definition.

The interval should be configured in ovn controller, and this is
already implemented using puppet-ovn.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2105312
Change-Id: I36499dccef6ff74a288942bd0a8f0257187387e7
(cherry picked from commit c11604c1406b2c11b862bdfc3bb5d5a40831d381)

subject: Fix to is_ca_ready() which used read_role() incorrectly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-14 11:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_reactive_vault_handlers.py', 'src/lib/charm/vault_pki.py', 'unit_tests/test_lib_charm_vault_pki.py'], 'message': 'Fix to is_ca_ready() which used read_role() incorrectly

A recent change (1) switched to the newer methods in
hvac 11.2, but unfortunately the semantics between
client.secrets.pki.read_role() and client.read() are different,
in that the latter returns None on InvalidPath, whereas the former
allow the exception to bubble up.

Also updates tests and fixes a mocking issue on service_reload.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-vault/+/848205

Change-Id: Id3d112104b1aa45b242e402709fb855131d5203e

commit_message:
Fix to is_ca_ready() which used read_role() incorrectly

A recent change (1) switched to the newer methods in
hvac 11.2, but unfortunately the semantics between
client.secrets.pki.read_role() and client.read() are different,
in that the latter returns None on InvalidPath, whereas the former
allow the exception to bubble up.

Also updates tests and fixes a mocking issue on service_reload.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-vault/+/848205

Change-Id: Id3d112104b1aa45b242e402709fb855131d5203e

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-06-10 14:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/db/test_sa_api.py'], 'message': "Remove manual __signature__ setting on wrappers

The primary reason to set __signature__ is to cache the generated
inspect.Signature object in a case where you're calling
inspect.signature() multiple times on a function, which we don't
currently do.

The accompanying unit test demonstrates that you don't need to
set __signature__ when using functools.wraps.

Change-Id: I47cbc373d985dde98bdb176f0ff0561783629f7d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove manual __signature__ setting on wrappers

The primary reason to set __signature__ is to cache the generated
inspect.Signature object in a case where you're calling
inspect.signature() multiple times on a function, which we don't
currently do.

The accompanying unit test demonstrates that you don't need to
set __signature__ when using functools.wraps.

Change-Id: I47cbc373d985dde98bdb176f0ff0561783629f7d

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warnings:

  The "whens" argument to case() is now passed using positional style

  The "whens" argument to case(), when referring to a sequence of items,
  is now passed as a series of positional elements, rather than as a

Change-Id: I8f9dec66a401103b3c4eced99a3fabb19655da10
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Pass case.whens as positionals, not a list

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warnings:

  The "whens" argument to case() is now passed using positional style
  only, not as a keyword argument.

  The "whens" argument to case(), when referring to a sequence of items,
  is now passed as a series of positional elements, rather than as a
  list.

Change-Id: I8f9dec66a401103b3c4eced99a3fabb19655da10
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Domain names in metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-10 16:41:33.000000000', 'files': ['specs/zed/approved/domain-names-in-metadata.rst'], 'message': "Domain names in metadata

Currently, there is no way for a user booting an instance to tell the
instance's guest operating system what is the domain name of the instance.
Using Fully Qualified Domain Names (FQDN) as the instance hostname was
unintentionally allowed for a period of time, but with the merging of [1] that
ability went away.

Neutron is working on a feature to expose a network's ``dns_domain`` field via
the DHCP agent to the guest operating system [2].

However, if cloud-init is running in the guest, cloud-init may overwrite the
domain name provided by DHCP. Cloud-init uses the Nova metadata API as an
information source. An instance may have multiple ports, each belonging to a
distinct network with a distinct ``dns_domain``. The purpose of this spec is to
provides these domain names in the instance metadata.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764482
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/832658

Change-Id: Ia60ecfb277844cd6b7cfa8b4f2eb968998f4ab3e
"}]
commit_message:
Domain names in metadata

Currently, there is no way for a user booting an instance to tell the
instance's guest operating system what is the domain name of the instance.
Using Fully Qualified Domain Names (FQDN) as the instance hostname was
unintentionally allowed for a period of time, but with the merging of [1] that
ability went away.

Neutron is working on a feature to expose a network's ``dns_domain`` field via
the DHCP agent to the guest operating system [2].

However, if cloud-init is running in the guest, cloud-init may overwrite the
domain name provided by DHCP. Cloud-init uses the Nova metadata API as an
information source. An instance may have multiple ports, each belonging to a
distinct network with a distinct ``dns_domain``. The purpose of this spec is to
provides these domain names in the instance metadata.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764482
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/832658

Change-Id: Ia60ecfb277844cd6b7cfa8b4f2eb968998f4ab3e

we should skip the task instead.

commit_message:
[train-only] Add deprecation notice to rear heat template

The heat template that installs ReaR on controllers is deprecated as of
16.2, and will be removed from 17.0 onwards. A deprecation notice has
been added to highlight the fact.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2097611
Change-Id: Ic01c44ba35b6d28cb45879b1006633ac1fcf8d08

subject: RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-14 11:12:56.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/utils.py', 'os_brick/tests/test_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rbd-disconnect-failure-9efa6932df40271b.yaml'], 'message': 'RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
(cherry picked from commit dde8f102b714e2e4001a3fe82f975cd9978ac1c5)
(cherry picked from commit 743002cc269ac1e91d8df2eee5f4fdad3d14c365)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
(cherry picked from commit dde8f102b714e2e4001a3fe82f975cd9978ac1c5)
(cherry picked from commit 743002cc269ac1e91d8df2eee5f4fdad3d14c365)

commit_message:
requirements: Remove explicit pyparsing dependency

This was added nearly a decade ago to work around a packaging bug in
cmd2. We don't use this explicitly ourselves so we can and should remove
it. Do that.

Change-Id: Ia6061a22b9037d157c0b2afecb4e06bbc62c2d74
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ignore molcule files for deployment jobs

Any change in molecule test files does not affect functionality. Thus
there is no need to run jobs which involves deployment if only the test
files are updated.

Change-Id: Ia5cfbee55f094486eaed9f5fd51316654b57025b

commit_message:
tripleo_bootstrap: update for standalone roles

tripleo_bootstrap/tasks/main.yml is broken out into bootstrap.yml and
puppet.yml tasks so that those can be individually selected. main.yml
imports both for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia8fa9c32d54a7e143cdbb85cde73d30532288daf
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Configure ovn sb connection for the ovn provider

The OVN provider requires connections to the OVN sb db in order to
receive events for associating FIP/VIPs and healthchecks.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/octavia/provider/ovn.pp
	spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_octavia_provider_ovn_spec.rb

Change-Id: I0b2250aa2d98e6ed02ccb7194183ebdcede97c9e

commit_message:
Validate vip address

Validates if the provided vip address(es) are in the subnet that the unit is in. If not, shows the message with invalid vips along with 'blocked' status.

Closes-Bug: #1958178
Change-Id: I6bb3e21f3934d6d2483564fba9216504a62d15dc

commit_message:
Adds DataCore Volume Drivers

The iSCSI and Fibre Channel volume drivers for DataCore’s
SANsymphony and Hyper-converged Virtual SAN storage
support the core/minimum feature set:
 - Volume Create/Delete
 - Volume Attach/Detach
 - Snapshot Create/Delete
 - Create Volume from Snapshot
 - Get Volume Stats
 - Copy Image to Volume
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone Volume
 - Extend Volume

Implements: blueprint datacore-volume-driver

Change-Id: If0fc0e1993ad3430022be3d522ccf9bd27ef9c31

commit_message:
Handle no replicator targettoken case better

Display an informative error message if no `targettoken` was provided.

```
$ glance-replicator size az3:9292
2016-07-05 07:36:48.365 69704 CRITICAL glance [-] MissingCredentialError: Missing required credential: targettoken
...
```

Closes-Bug: #1599187

Change-Id: Ib06aa2544fbce67101d9a2c91e9ec9065ec18fa5

subject: Add support for using os_client_config cloud names
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-04 19:29:25.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/utils.py', 'requirements.txt', 'glance/cmd/replicator.py'], 'message': 'Add support for using os_client_config cloud names

Instead of providing a glance URL and token, the user can provide the
name of a cloud in a `clouds.yaml` file.

Allowing a cloud name makes the tool easier to use -- e.g.:

    $ glance-replicator size az4
    $ glance-replicator compare az2 az3

Change-Id: I7e3b5714807e80797a103122373a5c3dd8ff4c80
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for using os_client_config cloud names

Instead of providing a glance URL and token, the user can provide the
name of a cloud in a `clouds.yaml` file.

Allowing a cloud name makes the tool easier to use -- e.g.:

    $ glance-replicator size az4
    $ glance-replicator compare az2 az3

Change-Id: I7e3b5714807e80797a103122373a5c3dd8ff4c80

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-22 19:23:59.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_glance_replicator.py', 'glance/cmd/replicator.py'], 'message': 'Migrate glance-replicator to requests

In its current state, glance-replicator uses httplib and thus does not
properly verify HTTPS connections. Switching to requests supports automatic
certificate verification on all HTTPS connections. Also the patch adds the
command-line option for specifying a custom certificate bundle to be used when
verifying the server certificate.

Change-Id: I2ad82098b9acababb277865b400388ad0507bd58
Closes-Bug: #1408940
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate glance-replicator to requests

In its current state, glance-replicator uses httplib and thus does not
properly verify HTTPS connections. Switching to requests supports automatic
certificate verification on all HTTPS connections. Also the patch adds the
command-line option for specifying a custom certificate bundle to be used when
verifying the server certificate.

Change-Id: I2ad82098b9acababb277865b400388ad0507bd58
Closes-Bug: #1408940

commit_message:
Glance replicator: move from v1 to v2

The first version of the API has been deprecated a while ago, but we
never moved glance-replicator to v2. We also remove two related options
that have been deprecated since

Change-Id: I540e2cfb67fae91822936aa565213e1693c836b6
Closes-Bug: #1830026

subject: Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-13 23:18:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py'], 'message': "Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)

commit_message:
Change the default ip for the nfs server

Originally, tripleo-quickstart was used to deploy BnR development
environments, but since then, the team has migrated to use infrared
almost exclusively. This patch sets the nfs server ip addres to the
default address configured by infrared on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I243bfef4dc36b09c0129390c71b2af0cc1cd1fd9

commit_message:
Replace os-simple-tenant-usage with os-simple-project-usage

This patch replaces 'os-simple-tenant-usage' with
'os-simple-project-usage', and changed tenant-* to proejct-*.

And changed the '/os-simple-tenant-usage' url path  to
'/os-simple-project-usage'.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id
Change-Id: I62efd6b1334f70146c62d145661df1bac49912dc

Change-Id: I5f315b4d55211148353701033e4b819a7eb2f23e

The path to the repositories passed by the user may not have
a system context and then it may not visibile inside the container,
unless :z is specified.

The issue can be seen at least in wallaby (caught in a downstream

commit_message:
Fix, yum operations: set SELinux context for repo paths

The path to the repositories passed by the user may not have
a system context and then it may not visibile inside the container,
unless :z is specified.

The issue can be seen at least in wallaby (caught in a downstream
build), while it used to work on train (maybe different podman?),
but the addition of :z doesn't seem to break the latter branch.

Closes-Bug: #1981340
Change-Id: If14c2249da09a5d855f33abf9b68f5897aa43490

The OpenInfra Foundation community managers are collaborating on a
document about how projects can apply The Four Opens in practical
terms, avoid common pitfalls, and learn hard-won lessons from

commit_message:
Add a new openinfra/way project

The OpenInfra Foundation community managers are collaborating on a
document about how projects can apply The Four Opens in practical
terms, avoid common pitfalls, and learn hard-won lessons from
free/libre open source projects which have come before.

This project will start empty, and then once created an initial
change will add the relevant boilerplate files.

Change-Id: I98f8a91442f4b1250189af2ec1234bf2814a7a53

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-05-26 15:49:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_temp_url_negative.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_temp_url.py'], 'message': "tempurl: Deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

There's already a patch for Swfit from 2017[3], and this patch will
update tempest side.

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/525771

Change-Id: I0e9073955604ada493ec64264c6a5932627e1138
"}]
commit_message:
tempurl: Deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

There's already a patch for Swfit from 2017[3], and this patch will
update tempest side.

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/525771

Change-Id: I0e9073955604ada493ec64264c6a5932627e1138
