commit_message:
Fix QoS selection for SRIOV environments

When QoS is set in the neutron-api charm, the neutron-openvswitch
charm needs to add 'extensions = qos' to the sriov_agent.ini
file.

Closes-bug: #1938277
Change-Id: I44fbf5991d2606161b1bcbc064d4bc68a2fbbb5b
(cherry picked from commit 2a6cba8e6f6c609676a713e496ffd6f44264525d)
(cherry picked from commit 561a44e9489913bd191b2854a496b25913fd045a)

revisions:

commit_message:
Fixes Nova live-migration post-copy

Live migration post-copy was not working because to be effective,
'live_migration_timeout_action' must be set to 'force_complete'.

Closes-bug: #1950894
Change-Id: I66984a12b89cb0ac2aeebeb393a6f6c026d865da
(cherry picked from commit d04cbcea20915c7db6011c7e53cdc53613ee9744)

subject: RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 16:27:45.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/utils.py', 'os_brick/tests/test_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rbd-disconnect-failure-9efa6932df40271b.yaml'], 'message': 'RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
(cherry picked from commit dde8f102b714e2e4001a3fe82f975cd9978ac1c5)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
(cherry picked from commit dde8f102b714e2e4001a3fe82f975cd9978ac1c5)

subject: Log when waiting to acquire lock
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-07 18:04:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/log_acquiring_lock-1b224c0b1562ec97.yaml'], 'message': "Log when waiting to acquire lock

We currently have no log entry when we start trying to acquire a lock.

In general this is ok, but there are cases where it can be problematic,
for example if we have a deadlock situation or if a lock takes a very
long time to be acquired.

In those scenarios looking at the logs we would see the operation
proceed normally and suddenly go completely silent without knowing that
it's waiting for a lock to be freed.

This patch adds a debug log message right before trying to acquire the
lock so we can detect those situations.

Change-Id: I1354dfb98b0927ae167802ecc4ab1d34f6b4d720
"}]
commit_message:
Log when waiting to acquire lock

We currently have no log entry when we start trying to acquire a lock.

In general this is ok, but there are cases where it can be problematic,
for example if we have a deadlock situation or if a lock takes a very
long time to be acquired.

In those scenarios looking at the logs we would see the operation
proceed normally and suddenly go completely silent without knowing that
it's waiting for a lock to be freed.

This patch adds a debug log message right before trying to acquire the
lock so we can detect those situations.

Change-Id: I1354dfb98b0927ae167802ecc4ab1d34f6b4d720

subject: Fix backward compatibility of compare volume stats
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-06-30 15:26:11.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/admin/test_backends_capabilities.py'], 'message': 'Fix backward compatibility of compare volume stats

When we fixed tempest test "test_compare_volume_stats_values" (Change-Id
I04d0eaa1f6dba16bd11052f91a3d1d0967029ea6) to make it work with the
"storage_protocol" canonical names that are returned by Cinder master on
the get-pools call (after Change-Id Change-Id:
I07d74078dbb102490dd722029e32c74cec3aa44c) we made the test non-backward
compatible, because stable releases don't return canonical names.

For example the NFS driver will return value "nfs" in stable releases,
but the test expects it to be "NFS" and thus will fail.

This patch fixes this by converting "storage_protocol" for the result of
both the get-pools and get-capabilities calls.

So we have 3 different cases:

- Current cinder master code --> Should work with current test

- Stable cinder branches with some backends (eg: NFS) --> Fixed by this
  patch

- Future Cinder when get-capabilities returns canonical name (Change-Id
  I8b21fbc2c8ef29689f101f6c397550604662cd8a) --> Works with or without
  this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1979826
Change-Id: I56099463791bb9a0bda18cbf7d315825562042aa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix backward compatibility of compare volume stats

When we fixed tempest test "test_compare_volume_stats_values" (Change-Id
I04d0eaa1f6dba16bd11052f91a3d1d0967029ea6) to make it work with the
"storage_protocol" canonical names that are returned by Cinder master on
the get-pools call (after Change-Id Change-Id:
I07d74078dbb102490dd722029e32c74cec3aa44c) we made the test non-backward
compatible, because stable releases don't return canonical names.

For example the NFS driver will return value "nfs" in stable releases,
but the test expects it to be "NFS" and thus will fail.

This patch fixes this by converting "storage_protocol" for the result of
both the get-pools and get-capabilities calls.

So we have 3 different cases:

- Current cinder master code --> Should work with current test

- Stable cinder branches with some backends (eg: NFS) --> Fixed by this
  patch

- Future Cinder when get-capabilities returns canonical name (Change-Id
  I8b21fbc2c8ef29689f101f6c397550604662cd8a) --> Works with or without
  this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1979826
Change-Id: I56099463791bb9a0bda18cbf7d315825562042aa

commit_message:
CentOS 9: Switch back to puppetlabs packages

CnetOS 9 packages were already released in the puppetlabs repo.

This removes the workaround to use RDO packages, which was earlier
added to run integration jobs on CentOS Stream 9 before the packages
were released[1].

[1] f384effdb42e0cbe19e137f0411b09ac8fef5b48

Change-Id: I0b9529b6a4f1c4beefa72b6e32b586b1ac9bea73

commit_message:
Neutron: Stop testing linuxbridge mechanism driver

Neutron team decided to make the driver experimental and it won't be
actively maintained.

This change switches the mechanism driver used in the scenario 003 job
from linuxbridge driver to ovn driver, to use only maintained drivers.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/845181
Change-Id: I06641daa4c5e9ecce894cd68d18f165554b8269d

Currently the tripleo-STACK-baremetal.yaml includes the instances
of the Roles but it does not include the resource_class.

This patch add the resource_class to the instance when is possible.

subject: Remove handling of 'u' prefix
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-07-10 16:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_identity_provider/openstack_spec.rb'], 'message': "Remove handling of 'u' prefix

... because the prefix is no longer printed in Python 3.

In python 2
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{u'foo': u'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
[u'foo', 'baa']

In python 3
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{'foo': 'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
['foo', 'baa']

Change-Id: I4ba22f0b3f4a62d5f28c2e080fbc06702c0bf30d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove handling of 'u' prefix

... because the prefix is no longer printed in Python 3.

In python 2
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{u'foo': u'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
[u'foo', 'baa']

In python 3
>>> print({u'foo': u'baa'})
{'foo': 'baa'}
>>> print([u'foo', 'baa'])
['foo', 'baa']

Change-Id: I4ba22f0b3f4a62d5f28c2e080fbc06702c0bf30d

subject: Bump mariadb version.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-07-13 13:12:48.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_server_setup.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/mariadb_security_upgrade-24e89cb878cc1389.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Bump mariadb version.

This bump will fix:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27376
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27377
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27380

We also modify workaround applied for 10.5 upgrade wrt to bug [1]
as it has been added extra tools to help with checking state of upgrade.

New flag --check-if-upgrade-is-needed is checking if any upgrade is
already running and waits until it's finished.
It exits with rc 0 if upgrade is required and 1 if not.

If upgrade is required, we fall into rescue and perform upgrade.

[1] https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-27068

Related-Bug: #1979728

Change-Id: I90286b01b5578df04447155c69c92f823388185a
"}]
commit_message:
Bump mariadb version.

This bump will fix:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27376
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27377
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27380

We also modify workaround applied for 10.5 upgrade wrt to bug [1]
as it has been added extra tools to help with checking state of upgrade.

New flag --check-if-upgrade-is-needed is checking if any upgrade is
already running and waits until it's finished.
It exits with rc 0 if upgrade is required and 1 if not.

If upgrade is required, we fall into rescue and perform upgrade.

[1] https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-27068

Related-Bug: #1979728

Change-Id: I90286b01b5578df04447155c69c92f823388185a

subject: Modify run_once behavior of tripleo_free strategy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 14:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/strategy/tripleo_free.py'], 'message': "Modify run_once behavior of tripleo_free strategy

It's very difficult to ensure that tasks are written without
run_once, expecting that they would be run with tripleo_free.
As tripleo_free does not ensure that the tasks are successfully
executed with run_once, let's go back to original ansible free
strategy behavior of running it for all hosts.

Change-Id: I1c67885f553aee519466249ac056f75071014c24
Resolves: rhbz#2061393
(cherry picked from commit 83f5ff5edf19a71491b1299055f24812a78754f4)
(cherry picked from commit baa4ebf7f50c22fd592b8b65247a0e2d3b908627)
"}]
commit_message:
Modify run_once behavior of tripleo_free strategy

It's very difficult to ensure that tasks are written without
run_once, expecting that they would be run with tripleo_free.
As tripleo_free does not ensure that the tasks are successfully
executed with run_once, let's go back to original ansible free
strategy behavior of running it for all hosts.

Change-Id: I1c67885f553aee519466249ac056f75071014c24
Resolves: rhbz#2061393
(cherry picked from commit 83f5ff5edf19a71491b1299055f24812a78754f4)
(cherry picked from commit baa4ebf7f50c22fd592b8b65247a0e2d3b908627)

subject: Fix tempest_allow logic
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-07-11 22:11:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/tasks/tempest.yml'], 'message': "Fix tempest_allow logic

Since we weren't using the tempest-allow role before, the logic was set
to be executed when tempest_test_whitelist wasn't defined, which is
fine, but to run skipped jobs, the allowed list was being overwriten.
This patch add the logic to only run the tempest-allow role when
tempest_run_skipped is set to false (default).

Change-Id: Ie4a5b6a764d19ce49f703804daaa50425be1bb6f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest_allow logic

Since we weren't using the tempest-allow role before, the logic was set
to be executed when tempest_test_whitelist wasn't defined, which is
fine, but to run skipped jobs, the allowed list was being overwriten.
This patch add the logic to only run the tempest-allow role when
tempest_run_skipped is set to false (default).

Change-Id: Ie4a5b6a764d19ce49f703804daaa50425be1bb6f

commit_message:
Remove setup_clients

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Deleted methods:
        * setup_clients

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: I3f63b3a0d4fd60b7824550f5c3deeb8cdb3d9ca9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-26 03:57:07.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/base-upstream.yaml', 'zuul.d/base.yaml'], 'message': "Don't override ovb branch in base jobs

This change removes the stable/2.0 checkout override for
openstack-virtual-baremetal so that jobs run master by default.
Individual stable jobs can override to stable/2.0 in the actual job
definition, for example:

https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/zuul.d/tripleo.yaml#L103-L120

commit_message:
Don't override ovb branch in base jobs

This change removes the stable/2.0 checkout override for
openstack-virtual-baremetal so that jobs run master by default.
Individual stable jobs can override to stable/2.0 in the actual job
definition, for example:

https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/zuul.d/tripleo.yaml#L103-L120

Change-Id: I43e13613ce432ed16f3adfe0cb1e6e5c44ba9e5b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-05-20 18:01:42.000000000', 'files': ['bin/install_openstackbmc.sh'], 'message': 'Explicitly support only centos-7 on the bmc host

This change removes the pre-built image support and explicitly
installs for centos-7 base images. There are likely no pre-built image
deployments in the wild, they all appear to use a base centos-7 image
(this includes the bmc-template image used in RDO CI).

This change is the first in a series to upgrade the BMC host to CentOS
versions 8 and 9-stream.

Change-Id: I136b16528b722a6d38235ffcd571f3591d29e679
(cherry picked from commit 01d82d7544fe690ee698302c19fabf20385c5929)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly support only centos-7 on the bmc host

This change removes the pre-built image support and explicitly
installs for centos-7 base images. There are likely no pre-built image
deployments in the wild, they all appear to use a base centos-7 image
(this includes the bmc-template image used in RDO CI).

This change is the first in a series to upgrade the BMC host to CentOS
versions 8 and 9-stream.

Change-Id: I136b16528b722a6d38235ffcd571f3591d29e679
(cherry picked from commit 01d82d7544fe690ee698302c19fabf20385c5929)

commit_message:
Revert "Set growvols_args for all Controller roles"

Role-specific defaults for growvols_args will assign some space to
/srv, so it is no longer necessary to set a custom growvols_args for
Controller nodes. Reverting this change provides test coverage of the
defaults mechanism, and validates the default values with the test
disk sizes.

This reverts commit c9aca4f7bf32b956e0e1963d1f25441286c869fa.
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/837438

Change-Id: I04c723e77c0fe5ba724b26a469a1e846cf470548

commit_message:
Handle disappearing pids in mlock_report.py

If a pid disappears on us while we're reading, we should just continue
on.

EnvironmentError is just an alias for OSError since Python 3.3, so use
the latter name. [0]

[0] https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError

Change-Id: I3a25cca328e1469f72c84a118a9691c1c0258bc4
Closes-Bug: #1926434
(cherry picked from commit b02a43291cc5e2d5677ecbb80c0fd608d67a1374)

subject: Use network UUID for floating_network_name
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-07-12 08:39:24.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tempest.conf.j2'], 'message': "Use network UUID for floating_network_name

``floating_network_name`` works well with UUIDs as well.

This change doesn't make any difference when tempest creates public
network.

But when it's not, operator does not set ``tempest_public_net_name``
which leaves ``floating_network_name`` with a defeault value.

In order to fix ``floating_network_name`` behavior for both scenarios,
it should be set to the ``tempest_neutron_public_network_id``.

"}]
commit_message:
Use network UUID for floating_network_name

``floating_network_name`` works well with UUIDs as well.

This change doesn't make any difference when tempest creates public
network.

But when it's not, operator does not set ``tempest_public_net_name``
which leaves ``floating_network_name`` with a defeault value.

In order to fix ``floating_network_name`` behavior for both scenarios,
it should be set to the ``tempest_neutron_public_network_id``.

We do the same thing for ``public_network_id``.

Change-Id: I10e0c49b0d89b9530a523e9db79d5c7aa52359a4

subject: Make router creation independent from tempest_public_net_create
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-11 15:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/tempest_resources.yml'], 'message': "Make router creation independent from tempest_public_net_create

Currently when ``tempest_router_create`` is enabled, playbook requires
``tempest_public_net_create`` to be set.

It's an incorrect behavior. Router creation should only require public
network to exist. It does not matter if that public network was created
by tempest or operator.

Change-Id: Icaa223ed03837a68e9e84a89560cc2df10e3ed3e
"}]
commit_message:
Make router creation independent from tempest_public_net_create

Currently when ``tempest_router_create`` is enabled, playbook requires
``tempest_public_net_create`` to be set.

It's an incorrect behavior. Router creation should only require public
network to exist. It does not matter if that public network was created
by tempest or operator.

Change-Id: Icaa223ed03837a68e9e84a89560cc2df10e3ed3e

subject: Fix the behavior of defining fixed_network_name
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2022-07-12 08:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tempest.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix the behavior of defining fixed_network_name

Currently we define fixed_network_name only when
tempest_create_isolated_networks == False.

It makes things complicated because tempest_create_isolated_networks is
applicable only when dynamic credentials are used.

fixed_network_name should be also defined when dynamic credentials
are not used.

Basically the only scenario when fixed_network_name should not be
defined is using dynamic credentials together with
tempest_create_isolated_networks.

fixed_network_name should be defined in all other cases.

Change-Id: I547d70995de5afbdc84c9f4e86b2599ad4cb100b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the behavior of defining fixed_network_name

Currently we define fixed_network_name only when
tempest_create_isolated_networks == False.

It makes things complicated because tempest_create_isolated_networks is
applicable only when dynamic credentials are used.

fixed_network_name should be also defined when dynamic credentials
are not used.

Basically the only scenario when fixed_network_name should not be
defined is using dynamic credentials together with
tempest_create_isolated_networks.

fixed_network_name should be defined in all other cases.

Change-Id: I547d70995de5afbdc84c9f4e86b2599ad4cb100b

commit_message:
Make _create_loginable_secgroup public

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

_create_loginable_secgroup method isn't ready to be deleted yet, because its rulesets differs from tempest's. This method will be public now, so replaced methods will use this method over the tempest's one. Tempest doesn't allow to modify rulesets, but patch that will allow this is already proposed[2]. Some time after merging the mentioned tempest patch this plugin's implementation will be replaced.

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/835018

Change-Id: I6b61d810c4695ac4709173a69f1b920b7228a1d0

Change-Id: I25b622de40c02f3cc410070e04e2d5d0fd67abc9

commit_message:
Allow running Mistral API service without uWSGI

While running Mistral API service within uWSGI, Mistral's Cron
Triggers do not create Workflow Exectuions. This change would disable
Cron Triggers for all existing installations as running API service
within uWSGI stays enabled by default.

Change-Id: I25b622de40c02f3cc410070e04e2d5d0fd67abc9

subject: Override tripleo_ceph_client_vars in tripleo_run_cephadm role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 18:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_run_cephadm/tasks/prepare.yml'], 'message': 'Override tripleo_ceph_client_vars in tripleo_run_cephadm role

During config-download, the tripleo_run_cephadm role sets
up overrides and creates a script which then calls tasks
from the tripleo_cephadm role. When this happens it should
override the tripleo_ceph_client_vars to have the correct
config-download directory (relative to the current stack).
The tripleo_cephadm_spec_ansible_host variable follows the
same pattern.

Change-Id: I658bc5c2e37ad5af6991937ccec0933b844ddd63
Closes-Bug: #1981467
'}]
commit_message:
Override tripleo_ceph_client_vars in tripleo_run_cephadm role

During config-download, the tripleo_run_cephadm role sets
up overrides and creates a script which then calls tasks
from the tripleo_cephadm role. When this happens it should
override the tripleo_ceph_client_vars to have the correct
config-download directory (relative to the current stack).
The tripleo_cephadm_spec_ansible_host variable follows the
same pattern.

Change-Id: I658bc5c2e37ad5af6991937ccec0933b844ddd63
Closes-Bug: #1981467

commit_message:
Revert "Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0"

This reverts commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1.

Reason for revert: The nova migration wrapper has suppoted
virt-ssh-helper for some time now.
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/nova-distgit/+/36142
https://github.com/rdo-packages/nova-distgit/commit/d5aba75f3b5589e156afeec915dcfcd4eca4eafe

Forcing netcat now prevents live migration on centos/rhel 9 as
netcat is not installed https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2089520
so we should revert back to the default auto proxy.

Change-Id: Id4a77280f8a977a2b319078d66e6d963d6babdc9
(cherry picked from commit 280abc7354f60321283192d2fa0245f050ab6346)

commit_message:
Revert "Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0"

This reverts commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1.

Reason for revert: The nova migration wrapper has suppoted
virt-ssh-helper for some time now.
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/nova-distgit/+/36142
https://github.com/rdo-packages/nova-distgit/commit/d5aba75f3b5589e156afeec915dcfcd4eca4eafe

Forcing netcat now prevents live migration on centos/rhel 9 as
netcat is not installed https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2089520
so we should revert back to the default auto proxy.

Change-Id: Id4a77280f8a977a2b319078d66e6d963d6babdc9

commit_message:
Skip Enable cleanup service in check mode

service/systemd check_mode fails[1] when service not found on host,
we should skip the task instead.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/68136

Change-Id: I88f82e0eac5fa35b7a6de9ef20e936ef35a47891

subject: Neutron: Migrate dvr parameters for ml2+ovs to ovs agent template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-28 23:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/neutron/neutron-ovs-agent-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Neutron: Migrate dvr parameters for ml2+ovs to ovs agent template

... from neutron-server template. These parameters are not used when
the other agents are used and are quite confusing especially when
ml2+ovn, which has the opposite default, is used.

Change-Id: Id6f83ae4621714d6a0d5234f571cd5480120e74b
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Migrate dvr parameters for ml2+ovs to ovs agent template

... from neutron-server template. These parameters are not used when
the other agents are used and are quite confusing especially when
ml2+ovn, which has the opposite default, is used.

Change-Id: Id6f83ae4621714d6a0d5234f571cd5480120e74b

commit_message:
Stop overriding irrelevant files

This was earlier introduced to workaround a problem temporally[1] but
was not intended to be left permanently.

[1] 82659a89a756788e7373dadd04dd964a48f7151a

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/layout.yaml

subject: Install rally only when rally_install is set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-14 14:55:03.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-rally-install.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Install rally only when rally_install is set

Currently we install rally regardless of user will.
It is default behaviour which is not possible to override.
So we add rally_install variable which defaults to false to control
whether to proceed with rally installation or not.

Change-Id: I325dee6ec071b6675bcfdadaf884ce8c26cf1ae9
(cherry picked from commit 65c4d7ca432ec36915295a6c7167800a8acda5b0)
'}]
commit_message:
Install rally only when rally_install is set

Currently we install rally regardless of user will.
It is default behaviour which is not possible to override.
So we add rally_install variable which defaults to false to control
whether to proceed with rally installation or not.

Change-Id: I325dee6ec071b6675bcfdadaf884ce8c26cf1ae9
(cherry picked from commit 65c4d7ca432ec36915295a6c7167800a8acda5b0)

commit_message:
DNM use pxe boot interface to try grub network boot

The pxe boot interface is now configured to do UEFI boot with grub
network boot instead of iPXE. Trying it here to see if it works.

Change-Id: Ie2abe3caa5587e1680070c03e788df6b03ef3a2e

subject: Remove _check_tenant_network_connectivity & _update_router_admin_state methods
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-07-12 18:45:14.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Remove _check_tenant_network_connectivity & _update_router_admin_state methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

	* _update_router_admin_state (not used)

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Iea47467e3c8849981d4ed3bd9dc61834031d7be0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove _check_tenant_network_connectivity & _update_router_admin_state methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Replaced methods:
	* _check_tenant_network_connectivity (not used)
	* _update_router_admin_state (not used)

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Iea47467e3c8849981d4ed3bd9dc61834031d7be0

subject: Gather build hosts facts once.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 10:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Gather build hosts facts once.

In [1] the build host facts gathering was moved from a place in the
code which was covered by run_once to one that is not. The task is
now missing a run_once so it iterates over the repo_all group for
each host in the play which could be a very large number of tasks.

[1]  I79a10a3f774246ab9c57313f19f3804f9422e08c

Change-Id: Ic86c19ca48fb55ad2c464c22f31ac41c5cc4c2e5
(cherry picked from commit 295827ac59231aa7ec6d6c3a01cc01c4c9164ab5)
'}]
commit_message:
Gather build hosts facts once.

In [1] the build host facts gathering was moved from a place in the
code which was covered by run_once to one that is not. The task is
now missing a run_once so it iterates over the repo_all group for
each host in the play which could be a very large number of tasks.

[1]  I79a10a3f774246ab9c57313f19f3804f9422e08c

Change-Id: Ic86c19ca48fb55ad2c464c22f31ac41c5cc4c2e5
(cherry picked from commit 295827ac59231aa7ec6d6c3a01cc01c4c9164ab5)

commit_message:
Redis required for designate central service

Designate central uses redis to improve task coordination under load.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/designate/producer.pp
	spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_designate_producer_spec.rb

Note: to properly configure coordination parameters, this requires an
additional non-trivial backport to puppet-designate to set
designate_config.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-designate/+/848300


Change-Id: Icc23208945304913cdaeede703c486064646379a
(cherry picked from commit 948540288cd3fc5c62bab0d6bffb5ac58078c4f2)

commit_message:
Exclude /var/log/journal from log collection

The binary journals are not portable and we extract text files
for the interesting services. Omit these from the log collection.

Change-Id: Ic669712f8a1cbfa6bfc8255590f3984034c8643e
(cherry picked from commit 06922f43812ff872c53b47cda568ae065df22d0c)

commit_message:
Add mistral-extra in the mistral venv

Mistral has split the openstack action from the main repo, this patch
install the extra actions into the venv so we can have openstack-action
in it.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-11 23:03:17.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/basic_manila_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/804365
Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: I41a6fe11e8ab39a60b19299da18ee085a10dc202
(cherry picked from commit f29a3051fc097759e82149e8ea21cffd8c67225d)
'}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/804365
Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: I41a6fe11e8ab39a60b19299da18ee085a10dc202
(cherry picked from commit f29a3051fc097759e82149e8ea21cffd8c67225d)

subject: RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 14:41:40.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/utils.py', 'os_brick/tests/test_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rbd-disconnect-failure-9efa6932df40271b.yaml'], 'message': 'RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad

commit_message:
Added NovaDisableComputeServiceCheckForFfu var

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/826097 adds
the service version check workaround for FFU.

In order to reuse this functionality in tripleo deployment,
NovaDisableComputeServiceCheckForFfu var is added to set
workarounds/disable_compute_service_check_for_ffu=false
in nova.conf.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/845737

Closes-Bug: #1961966
Closes-Bug: #1947959

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifbfd859e77ecf6831ced74e37aea1bd0ccdf4c5c
(cherry picked from commit 7ec40a3c5287e1f6bf37a281cf778a23cc11ef1a)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Update unsupported retype combinations

1. Allowing for metro to metro as the volume is simply being moved within
the masking view.
2. Updating the message, as target metro is not possible when source is
not metro and host assisted migration does not support replicated
volumes.

Change-Id: I12d05d2ec670e8db037060b29e59eeb7cdd30ebc
(cherry picked from commit 28e7a46afea688bd9639fbfc0892f296e3bf1252)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - QoS should not be set on parent storage group

The parent storage group is just a hold all for the child
storage groups which contain attributes like service level and QoS.
Setting QoS on the parent storage group can cause problems as
having a higher I/O limit on the child than the parent is not
allowed and this is not the intention.  The fix is to set
QoS on the child storage groups only.

Closes-Bug: #1930290
Change-Id: Ib2c1a44086da1fa3c64611344221c9307be22296
(cherry picked from commit 1084de1f1666c2c5e9a850ef39c124bf74652dad)

FFU and other operations, we try to connect to 127.0.0.1 (see

Change-Id: Icd1c4b20cc14dc3ba68e896c94d12a198b115379

commit_message:
Add proxy validation for undercloud deployment.

New validation for proxy configuration as users will sometimes
add a proxy configuraiton which doesn't contain a no_proxy. In
FFU and other operations, we try to connect to 127.0.0.1 (see
heat helper) or another IP which should also be in no_proxy.

Change-Id: Icd1c4b20cc14dc3ba68e896c94d12a198b115379

subject: Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-13 09:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py'], 'message': "Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
"}]
commit_message:
Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039

subject: Modify run_once behavior of tripleo_free strategy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-12 11:10:41.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/strategy/tripleo_free.py'], 'message': "Modify run_once behavior of tripleo_free strategy

It's very difficult to ensure that tasks are written without
run_once, expecting that they would be run with tripleo_free.
As tripleo_free does not ensure that the tasks are successfully
executed with run_once, let's go back to original ansible free
strategy behavior of running it for all hosts.

Change-Id: I1c67885f553aee519466249ac056f75071014c24
Resolves: rhbz#2061393
(cherry picked from commit 83f5ff5edf19a71491b1299055f24812a78754f4)
"}]
commit_message:
Modify run_once behavior of tripleo_free strategy

It's very difficult to ensure that tasks are written without
run_once, expecting that they would be run with tripleo_free.
As tripleo_free does not ensure that the tasks are successfully
executed with run_once, let's go back to original ansible free
strategy behavior of running it for all hosts.

Change-Id: I1c67885f553aee519466249ac056f75071014c24
Resolves: rhbz#2061393
(cherry picked from commit 83f5ff5edf19a71491b1299055f24812a78754f4)

commit_message:
Stop logging sensitive login information

usernames and passwords must never be logged
by the service, even in debug mode.

commit_message:
Adjust OpenStack-Ansible deployment guide title

After changes were published I realized that OSA is not in line with
other deployment projects naming convention. At the same time intention
to change the name was to distinguish from kolla-ansible. Now I come up
with better idea how to be more aligned and explicit about what to
expect at the same time.

Change-Id: Ia620ba96bcd0e573dc2a8293cdf78905d8855fb2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-29 11:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'doc/source/configure-network-services.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron-vpnaas-custom-config-ad991bb02b9ed655.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow to provide custom configuration for VPNaaS

As we need to monitor vpn connection detailes, the only way to config vpnaas to log states and connections of vpn
is to provide own templates for VPNaaS configuration. With that we enable deployers to provide custom configuration
files for using with any vpn drivers (stronswan/openswan).

Co-Authored-By: Dmitriy Rabotyagov <noonedeadpunk@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I54dbd5c9690281af475312a277eab534403edf92
(cherry picked from commit 26b768ea5bcbe90c10e6ff8f47a64e0559fbd34d)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to provide custom configuration for VPNaaS

As we need to monitor vpn connection detailes, the only way to config vpnaas to log states and connections of vpn
is to provide own templates for VPNaaS configuration. With that we enable deployers to provide custom configuration
files for using with any vpn drivers (stronswan/openswan).

Co-Authored-By: Dmitriy Rabotyagov <noonedeadpunk@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I54dbd5c9690281af475312a277eab534403edf92
(cherry picked from commit 26b768ea5bcbe90c10e6ff8f47a64e0559fbd34d)

subject: Rework Rally chart
revisions:
[{'number': 59, 'created': '2021-12-13 22:08:00.000000000', 'files': ['rally/templates/svc-rally-nginx.yaml', 'rally/templates/configmap-rally-nginx.yaml', 'rally/templates/secret-rally-nginx-ssh-keys.yaml', 'rally/Chart.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/rally.yaml', 'rally/templates/bin/_run-task.sh.tpl', 'rally/templates/configmap-tasks.yaml', 'rally/templates/job-run-task.yaml', 'rally/templates/job-run-tasks_simultaneously.yaml', 'rally/templates/pvc-rally-nginx.yaml', 'rally/templates/bin/_bootstrap.sh.tpl', 'rally/templates/statefulset-rally-nginx.yaml', 'rally/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Rework Rally chart

 - Changed entrypoint script of run-test container:
   - Add the ability to specify a git repository and its
     branch/tag/commit with Rally scenarios.
   - Add a variable for list of the scenarios to be run.
   - Add scenarios skip.
   - Fix scenarios issue
     (https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1842769)
   - Add init.sh run for exteranal Rally scenarios run before.
 - Introduced rally-nginx pod with nginx service to host Rally results
   as web pages.
 - Add possibility to run rally tasks simultaneously

Change-Id: I69f1cc8b7913d1b50ef3d5d954557fa3712c82d3
'}]
commit_message:
Rework Rally chart

 - Changed entrypoint script of run-test container:
   - Add the ability to specify a git repository and its
     branch/tag/commit with Rally scenarios.
   - Add a variable for list of the scenarios to be run.
   - Add scenarios skip.
   - Fix scenarios issue
     (https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1842769)
   - Add init.sh run for exteranal Rally scenarios run before.
 - Introduced rally-nginx pod with nginx service to host Rally results
   as web pages.
 - Add possibility to run rally tasks simultaneously

Change-Id: I69f1cc8b7913d1b50ef3d5d954557fa3712c82d3

subject: [WIP] Don't run Nova cell setup until all compute services are up
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-08-13 14:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/templates/bin/_cell-setup-init.sh.tpl', 'nova/values.yaml', 'nova/templates/job-cell-setup.yaml', 'nova/templates/bin/_cell-compute-count-init.sh.tpl'], 'message': "[WIP] Don't run Nova cell setup until all compute services are up

This is a WIP. It's a change to add an additional init container
to the Nova cell setup job to get a count of compute nodes in the
cluster and to only proceed with the nova-manage command(s) once
the number of compute services in OpenStack match the exepcted
number of cluster compute nodes.

Change-Id: I3d7237380fb21b00168b4e1887403adaf3975365
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Don't run Nova cell setup until all compute services are up

This is a WIP. It's a change to add an additional init container
to the Nova cell setup job to get a count of compute nodes in the
cluster and to only proceed with the nova-manage command(s) once
the number of compute services in OpenStack match the exepcted
number of cluster compute nodes.

Change-Id: I3d7237380fb21b00168b4e1887403adaf3975365

commit_message:
[Keystone] Add more jobs for upgrade

The patch adds the following jobs, that are controlled
via manifests object

 * db-sync-contract
 * db-sync-expand
 * db-sync-migrate

The tasks are required during keystone rolling upgrade process.
Current patch will allow to execute tasks by changing manifests
object in values.yaml

Change-Id: Ida33d02a55c43aaa13cf16f0c20011eeb29bb7dc

commit_message:
[Nova] Move online db sync to separate job

Online Db sync have to be executed only when control plane
services are upgraded. In order to have ability to execute
online db sync directly via helm chart by modifying
manifest:nova_db_sync_onlune true|false during upgrade, move
it to own job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681476/
Change-Id: I2569350c014ba2671821728e7e59635b54d3335d

commit_message:
Mount l3-agent state path to hostPath

State path should be stored persistently in containerized deployment
environment, otherwise, some important information in this path will be
lost.

reference:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/18.0.0/neutron/agent/l3/link_local_allocator.py#L32-L41
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/18.0.0/neutron/agent/l3/fip_rule_priority_allocator.py#L35-L40

Closes-Bug: #1930642
Change-Id: Ia6358a9b589a1742425a5e284c9a7ef1cfe52e8a

commit_message:
Stop passing ironic_url to ansible modules

The ansible collection team wants to deprecate ironic_url in favour of
auth.endpoint. This has been supported for a long time, adjust
the no-auth code to use it.

This leave os_ironic_node_info, which should be replaced by the upstream
baremetal_node_info instead.

Change-Id: Icec366a4a5b66e77cc5ee9cf92248be68bd41807

commit_message:
Drop six library

The six library was introduced to bridge the gap
between Python2 and 3. This is no longer necessary
on branches where we are not supporting Python2.

subject: Improve connectivity check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-06 20:37:39.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_nodes_validation/tasks/ping.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_nodes_validation/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Improve connectivity check

Currently, the ICMP check can fail if the network
configuration takes too long. This can fail the
overall deployment, but the network configuration
can still be successful. This change broadens the
scope of the connectivity check by increasing the
number of ICMP requests sent each time. To make
it more flexibile and allowing for situations where
interfaces take a little longer to become active.

Change-Id: I89a3b9a562fb060293deb08dbc7e97aacfcc5b73
(cherry picked from commit 5d40212582aa893e9a2384e6e083512dabd4ebd5)
(cherry picked from commit a309d51a273eb4bb01fc62ae4eb9199b7ada60a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve connectivity check

Currently, the ICMP check can fail if the network
configuration takes too long. This can fail the
overall deployment, but the network configuration
can still be successful. This change broadens the
scope of the connectivity check by increasing the
number of ICMP requests sent each time. To make
it more flexibile and allowing for situations where
interfaces take a little longer to become active.

Change-Id: I89a3b9a562fb060293deb08dbc7e97aacfcc5b73
(cherry picked from commit 5d40212582aa893e9a2384e6e083512dabd4ebd5)
(cherry picked from commit a309d51a273eb4bb01fc62ae4eb9199b7ada60a4)

subject: Set minimal tempest version to 27.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-06-09 15:22:57.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Set minimal tempest version to 27.0.0

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Some methods replaced in scenario-manager-cleanup effort won't work
with tempest version lower than 27.0.0 therefore minimal tempest

Etherpad concerning this effort:

commit_message:
Set minimal tempest version to 27.0.0

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Some methods replaced in scenario-manager-cleanup effort won't work
with tempest version lower than 27.0.0 therefore minimal tempest
version must be updated in tempest plugins

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Iec0376fbfe12d0ccb20bc0b9215abdd590e2a2bc

commit_message:
Zed-2 Release for octavia-lib

This is the Zed milestone-2 release for octavia-lib.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If you are happy with the current release hash, please +1 this patch
and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new
commit hash to use once it is ready.

If a release is definitely not wanted at this time, please -1 and
leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

Any patches with no response will be assumed to be OK and will be

commit_message:
Gather build hosts facts once.

In [1] the build host facts gathering was moved from a place in the
code which was covered by run_once to one that is not. The task is
now missing a run_once so it iterates over the repo_all group for
each host in the play which could be a very large number of tasks.

[1]  I79a10a3f774246ab9c57313f19f3804f9422e08c

Change-Id: Ic86c19ca48fb55ad2c464c22f31ac41c5cc4c2e5

subject: Add support for ovn-lb on the provider network
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-07-11 12:52:57.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/ovn_bgp_driver.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/utils/driver_utils.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/tests/unit/drivers/openstack/watchers/test_bgp_watcher.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/utils/ovn.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/watchers/base_watcher.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/tests/unit/drivers/openstack/utils/test_ovn.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/watchers/bgp_watcher.py'], 'message': 'Add support for ovn-lb on the provider network

This patch ensures the ovn loadbalancers created on the provider
network can be exposed. It relies on the Load_Balancer SB DB table
to do so:
- Checks there is a modification in the datapath of the Load_Balancer,
  which means a member has been included in a different network than the
  provider. Note the ovn-lb with a VIP on the provider network are
  created with the provider network datapath. Then when the members
  are added, the datapath where those members are connected to is
  added to the Load_Balancer datapath.
- Ensure the event is only processed if the local node contains the
  cr-lrp for the router that connects the members to the provider
  network where the VIP is

Change-Id: If97ea3991ac9857aa26e8a4c24bbd8921ca987e8
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for ovn-lb on the provider network

This patch ensures the ovn loadbalancers created on the provider
network can be exposed. It relies on the Load_Balancer SB DB table
to do so:
- Checks there is a modification in the datapath of the Load_Balancer,
  which means a member has been included in a different network than the
  provider. Note the ovn-lb with a VIP on the provider network are
  created with the provider network datapath. Then when the members
  are added, the datapath where those members are connected to is
  added to the Load_Balancer datapath.
- Ensure the event is only processed if the local node contains the
  cr-lrp for the router that connects the members to the provider
  network where the VIP is

Change-Id: If97ea3991ac9857aa26e8a4c24bbd8921ca987e8

subject: Include os-brick configuration options
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-12 09:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['etc/oslo-config-generator/glance-cache.conf', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/glance-scrubber.conf', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/glance-api.conf'], 'message': 'Include os-brick configuration options

The cinder glance store now supports using an os-brick specific location
for file locks instead of using the one defined for the whole service
using the ``lock_path`` configuration option in the ``os_brick``
configuration section.

To render this option when generating the sample config file with ``tox
-egenconfig``, the ``os_brick`` namespace needs to be configured in the
oslo-config-generator config files and the os-brick dependency needs to
be present.

This patch adds the os-brick package as a dependency in the genconfig
test environment and adds the namespace to the relevant config files.

Depends-On: Ib11d63e3c388e12f145f40247d17030a566b8c5e
Change-Id: Ie25ab8bcc01a57e26da6a951e899659ec1782140
'}]
commit_message:
Include os-brick configuration options

The cinder glance store now supports using an os-brick specific location
for file locks instead of using the one defined for the whole service
using the ``lock_path`` configuration option in the ``os_brick``
configuration section.

To render this option when generating the sample config file with ``tox
-egenconfig``, the ``os_brick`` namespace needs to be configured in the
oslo-config-generator config files and the os-brick dependency needs to
be present.

This patch adds the os-brick package as a dependency in the genconfig
test environment and adds the namespace to the relevant config files.

Depends-On: Ib11d63e3c388e12f145f40247d17030a566b8c5e
Change-Id: Ie25ab8bcc01a57e26da6a951e899659ec1782140

commit_message:
Remove import of 'imp' module

Use importlib.util module instead of imp, since it's
being deprecated:

  DeprecationWarning: the imp module is deprecated in favour of
  importlib; see the module's documentation for alternative uses

Had to change test setup to call super() first to get around a
config issue I was seeing locally, causing the entire class of
tests to fail:

  oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError: no such option api_extensions_path
  in group [DEFAULT]

Closes-bug: #1981077

Change-Id: Ic171028a661c3f9f83f6758a57aaeab4450aa907

subject: Support os-brick specific lock_path for Cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-12 09:32:34.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/lock_path-cef9d6f5f52c3211.yaml', 'glance_store/_drivers/cinder.py'], 'message': "Support os-brick specific lock_path for Cinder

As a new feature relevant for the Cinder store, os-brick now supports
setting the location of file locks in a different location from the
locks of the service.

The functionality is intended for HCI deployments and hosts that are
running Cinder and Glance using Cinder backend.  In those scenarios the
service can use a service specific location for its file locks while
only sharing the location of os-brick with the other services.

To leverage this functionality the new os-brick code is needed and
method ``os_brick.setup`` needs to be called once the service
configuration options have been loaded.

The default value of the os-brick ``lock_path`` is the one set in
``oslo_concurrency``.

This patch adds support for this new feature in a backward compatible
way so code works even if using an os-brick version that doesn't have
this feature.  That is the case for many CI jobs that install os-brick
from PyPi instead of the code present in master.

Change-Id: Ib11d63e3c388e12f145f40247d17030a566b8c5e
"}]
commit_message:
Support os-brick specific lock_path for Cinder

As a new feature relevant for the Cinder store, os-brick now supports
setting the location of file locks in a different location from the
locks of the service.

The functionality is intended for HCI deployments and hosts that are
running Cinder and Glance using Cinder backend.  In those scenarios the
service can use a service specific location for its file locks while
only sharing the location of os-brick with the other services.

To leverage this functionality the new os-brick code is needed and
method ``os_brick.setup`` needs to be called once the service
configuration options have been loaded.

The default value of the os-brick ``lock_path`` is the one set in
``oslo_concurrency``.

This patch adds support for this new feature in a backward compatible
way so code works even if using an os-brick version that doesn't have
this feature.  That is the case for many CI jobs that install os-brick
from PyPi instead of the code present in master.

Change-Id: Ib11d63e3c388e12f145f40247d17030a566b8c5e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-06 10:28:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/hpe-3par-fix-multi-detach-in-multi-host-env-3f2211f29a336b6e.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': 'HPE 3PAR: In multi host env, fix multi-detach operation

In multi host environment, if volume is attached to instances present
on different hosts, detach operation works partially.
As a result, at later time the volume cannot be deleted.

Details are explained in launchpad bug.

This patch performs following:
During detach volume from instance, both possibilities are considered:
the instances can reside:
[1] either on same host.
[2] or on different hosts.

case [1]:
In such case, behaviour is same as earlier i.e vlun is not deleted
upon each detach operation i.e skip remainder of terminate volume
connection. The vluns are deleted only on last detach operation.

case [2]:
In such case, vlun of that host on 3par array is deleted separately
upon each detach operation.

Closes-Bug: #1958122
Change-Id: I47e8e86a495802a21570e23ecf7428fccc8b3d60
(cherry picked from commit 3ed2f38e54b84073f03ce1148c6dfcbbd37fc032)
'}]
commit_message:
HPE 3PAR: In multi host env, fix multi-detach operation

In multi host environment, if volume is attached to instances present
on different hosts, detach operation works partially.
As a result, at later time the volume cannot be deleted.

Details are explained in launchpad bug.

This patch performs following:
During detach volume from instance, both possibilities are considered:
the instances can reside:
[1] either on same host.
[2] or on different hosts.

case [1]:
In such case, behaviour is same as earlier i.e vlun is not deleted
upon each detach operation i.e skip remainder of terminate volume
connection. The vluns are deleted only on last detach operation.

case [2]:
In such case, vlun of that host on 3par array is deleted separately
upon each detach operation.

Closes-Bug: #1958122
Change-Id: I47e8e86a495802a21570e23ecf7428fccc8b3d60
(cherry picked from commit 3ed2f38e54b84073f03ce1148c6dfcbbd37fc032)

commit_message:
Generate new lower constraints

The lower constraints file was out of date, so this commit includes
a new one generated by build-lower-constraints from the requirements
project.

Also fix the error
TypeError: load_all() missing 1 required positional argument: 'Loader'
when loading the functional test cases

commit_message:
Fix api layer become slow when shutdown one control node

* memcache_socket_timeout support float number, change it to 0.25 for
  better performance[0]
* memcache dead retry time set to 900s[1]
* Option ``memcached_servers`` is deprecated in Mitaka. Operators should
  use oslo.cache configuration instead[2]

* [0] https://review.opendev.org/519353
* [1] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.cache/latest/configuration/#cache.memcache_dead_retry
* [2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/307718
Closes-Bug: #1980739
Change-Id: I47db333a1f0d735703e6559e2130315189e3d56e

Change-Id: I1adbc296156634cf64694dfc2e257b36ca2bdbd5

commit_message:

failed in gate with
```
Unable to freeze job graph: Job tripleo-ci-centos-8-undercloud-ffu-wallaby depends on tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider which was not run.
```
We fixed the the same issue for cs9 content provider in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/849103/
We need to use the same irrelvant files for cs8 content
provider so that it gets triggered and dependent jobs should run.

subject: [Temp] Remove molecule.yml file from irrelevant files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 14:25:23.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml'], 'message': '[Temp] Remove molecule.yml file from irrelevant files

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/848104/4#message-918158541888c10a8201d13ec4bee9e07173955f
failed in gate with
```
Unable to freeze job graph: Job tripleo-ci-centos-8-undercloud-ffu-wallaby depends on tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider which was not run.
```
We fixed the the same issue for cs9 content provider in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/849103/.
But if we apply the same fix for cs8 content provider then
it will allow the cs8 content provider to run on unwanted
change which is not good.

in order to get https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:unified_mol_config
merged.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I58d74f15de2c0c522e778d5660e0f99232bdc348
'}]
commit_message:
[Temp] Remove molecule.yml file from irrelevant files

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/848104/4#message-918158541888c10a8201d13ec4bee9e07173955f
failed in gate with
```
Unable to freeze job graph: Job tripleo-ci-centos-8-undercloud-ffu-wallaby depends on tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider which was not run.
```
We fixed the the same issue for cs9 content provider in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/849103/.
But if we apply the same fix for cs8 content provider then
it will allow the cs8 content provider to run on unwanted
change which is not good.

This patch temprorily removes the molecule.yml file from irrelevant files
in order to get https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:unified_mol_config
merged.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I58d74f15de2c0c522e778d5660e0f99232bdc348

commit_message:
Configure the oslo.concurrency lock_path

A recent change in os-brick [1], which is used by cinder backends,
requires external file locks. This patch adds support for configuring
the lock path, with a default value that matches the corresponding
lock paths used by other services that use os-brick (namely cinder
and nova).

[1] I6f7f7d19540361204d4ae3ead2bd6dcddb8fcd68

Closes-Bug: #1980539
Change-Id: I5ea6766656f4227a1c514777c03bbf78d4ac59cd
(cherry picked from commit 6f61ecd9c5b030817d0255fd8fd485722f9556f4)
(cherry picked from commit ba4ada0c70b31277b8569b71d40692b17c2a632b)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-07-12 19:54:47.000000000', 'files': ['whitebox_tempest_plugin/api/compute/test_sriov.py', 'whitebox_tempest_plugin/config.py'], 'message': 'Update NUMA Affinity tests for per port policy

policy, different policies, and evaluate precedence when the flavor has

In addition add tests around policy using image metadata as well. Also

commit_message:
Update NUMA Affinity tests for per port policy

Update the NUMAAffinity SR-IOV tests to also include policy on a per
port level to test [1]. Tests validate results when ports have a common
policy, different policies, and evaluate precedence when the flavor has
a different value from the ports utilized.

In addition add tests around policy using image metadata as well. Also
include two config options that confirm if image level or port level
affinity configuration is supported.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/773792/

Change-Id: Ic897ddb2f86c1de27342f56b3546735ed2829aec

subject: Minmum TTL value is zero
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-07 11:02:22.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/recordset.py', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_recordsets.py'], 'message': 'Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7
'}]
commit_message:
Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-12 18:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable container_ceph_updates for ceph nightly

This patch enables standalone_container_ceph_updates flag
in ceph nightly jobs. It was working before [1] because consumer
jobs were able to define different ceph tags and namespaces in
standalone role [2], but after [1], we restricted that only to
jobs that have that flag enabled.

commit_message:
Enable container_ceph_updates for ceph nightly

This patch enables standalone_container_ceph_updates flag
in ceph nightly jobs. It was working before [1] because consumer
jobs were able to define different ceph tags and namespaces in
standalone role [2], but after [1], we restricted that only to
jobs that have that flag enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1981329

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/846231
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/src/commit/7482df1efe87428b264fdea9b72ee4c7d383dbd2/roles/standalone/tasks/containers.yml#L128

Change-Id: I1cb85435d58f17bb8157a2dc01a9ba021b669959
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use cloudsmith repo for rabbit and erlang

Switch to using cloudsmith repo as a source for rabbitmq and erlang.

This allows us to be consistent about repository that is
used across supported distributions along with switching from
unreliable erlang-solutions that tend to fail periodically.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_rally/+/848718
Change-Id: Ia438ee3b0aa1ba95aff014776e936516b83181ec
(cherry picked from commit 4ab856bfefd07ca5fb39d66c93530e9b7ab0fe76)

commit_message:
Control rally-openstack installed version

At the moment we don't have control what version of rally-openstack
is being installed. So we are installing latest version available in
PyPi. However rally package version is defined in
rally-openstack constraints.

With this patch we add variables to be able to adjust source of
rally-openstack as well as pick version for installation.

We also temporary disable upgrade jobs to resolve circular dependency

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/847272
Change-Id: I8100dfd3544c0530815fb877b44b960d404f635b
(cherry picked from commit 136dfa02d050454d3b663186a212184a86b63c3e)

commit_message:
Update rally-task-neutron to have only ovs as mech driver

Neutron recently introduced the experimental feature concept and moved
linuxbridge driver under it as it lacks maintainers and has more and
more issues with its testing.
To use experimental feature the experimental cfg group must be filled
with linuxbridge = True, but rally-task-neutron don't need linuxbridge
driver.
The patch that introduce experimental framework check [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/845181
Related-Bug: #1980948

Change-Id: If2016c6b2cf03c064e2903549e0e991995275024

subject: Add default rate-limits for API endpoints and Horizon authentication
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-07-08 09:43:27.000000000', 'files': ['inventory/group_vars/haproxy/haproxy.yml'], 'message': 'Add default rate-limits for API endpoints and Horizon authentication

This patch adds rate limiting for any API call which results in a
4xx response by applying a common stick-table to each HAProxy
backend definition. The stick table can be overridden to allow
customisation of the behaviour.

An additional stick-table is defined for the Horizon endpoint to
enforce a 20-requests-per-10s-per-source-ip sliding window limit
on the horizon /auth path. This provides some protection against
credential stuffing attacks and will generate 429 response codes
to the client and in the HAProxy log. The log could be used by an
alerting system to detect potentially malicious traffic.

The defined rate limit does not include traffic from rfc1918 addresses
and this should be reviewed and overridden as necessary to protect
the external API endpoint.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/848657
Change-Id: I02ed08f9d3d12f7ad2e5dd3a45a699d766933877
'}]
commit_message:
Add default rate-limits for API endpoints and Horizon authentication

This patch adds rate limiting for any API call which results in a
4xx response by applying a common stick-table to each HAProxy
backend definition. The stick table can be overridden to allow
customisation of the behaviour.

An additional stick-table is defined for the Horizon endpoint to
enforce a 20-requests-per-10s-per-source-ip sliding window limit
on the horizon /auth path. This provides some protection against
credential stuffing attacks and will generate 429 response codes
to the client and in the HAProxy log. The log could be used by an
alerting system to detect potentially malicious traffic.

The defined rate limit does not include traffic from rfc1918 addresses
and this should be reviewed and overridden as necessary to protect
the external API endpoint.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/848657
Change-Id: I02ed08f9d3d12f7ad2e5dd3a45a699d766933877

subject: [Minor] Fix misspellings of "insufficient"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-14 17:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/exception.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_image_cache.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'ironic/common/images.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/storage/test_cinder.py', 'ironic/common/policy.py', 'ironic/common/utils.py'], 'message': '[Minor] Fix misspellings of "insufficient"

In a few places in the codebase, "insufficient" is misspelled as
"insufficent," which includes function names and exception class names.
This can be inconvenient for writing and debugging code, in which case
one would raise an exception/call a function and get an error that is
resolved by intentionally misspelling the function call.

The changes made here are mostly to the names of exceptions and
functions but also include some other instances of this misspelling
in docstrings, policy descriptions, etc. There were also some strings
describing policies in ironic/common/policy.py that were missing
spaces, which were also fixed.

Story: 2010089
Task: 45604
Change-Id: I7b65c449d5d30ca30f537a95a3ffd365492e0274
'}]
commit_message:
[Minor] Fix misspellings of "insufficient"

In a few places in the codebase, "insufficient" is misspelled as
"insufficent," which includes function names and exception class names.
This can be inconvenient for writing and debugging code, in which case
one would raise an exception/call a function and get an error that is
resolved by intentionally misspelling the function call.

The changes made here are mostly to the names of exceptions and
functions but also include some other instances of this misspelling
in docstrings, policy descriptions, etc. There were also some strings
describing policies in ironic/common/policy.py that were missing
spaces, which were also fixed.

Story: 2010089
Task: 45604
Change-Id: I7b65c449d5d30ca30f537a95a3ffd365492e0274

commit_message:
container_puppet_config: Merge volumes correctly

This change fixes the wrong handling of "volumes" key in puppet_config,
to avoid failure if there are multiple puppet_config definitions with
the same config_volume but different sets of volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1980905
Change-Id: I0e1fd858f3548b72d07a067db9e221eae3c77823

commit_message:
Deprecate env/enable-designate in favor of env/services/designate.yaml

The designate environment files predate the move to the separate
services directory for service environment files. This patch creates a
copy in the standard location and future documentation should reference
the new location. The old location should be removed post Xena.

Change-Id: I5a479c7235d7851a1895446d481a9ae044f9c3b5
(cherry picked from commit 0fe7045fa0df83d118ff5ffa428553a006170be9)

subject: Neutron: Generate wrapper scripts during config file generation
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2022-07-07 05:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/neutron/neutron-dhcp-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-l3-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/ovn/ovn-metadata-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Neutron: Generate wrapper scripts during config file generation

... instead of launching separate containers. The wrapper scripts does
not require access to ovs resources, so can be created in the initial

This change also removes unnecessary bind mounts to provide access to
ovs from a few puppet tasks. These tasks are just manipulating local
files and do not require access to ovs.

commit_message:
Neutron: Generate wrapper scripts during config file generation

... instead of launching separate containers. The wrapper scripts does
not require access to ovs resources, so can be created in the initial
phase.

This change also removes unnecessary bind mounts to provide access to
ovs from a few puppet tasks. These tasks are just manipulating local
files and do not require access to ovs.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/848925
Change-Id: Ie01fd34b903448089db890003b3c98f817d6d62b

commit_message:
Designate: support configuring non-ooo-deployed binds

Colloquially referred to as "bring your own bind", this allows designate
to be configured with external bind instances.

Note: also adds missing linkage between unbound and deployed bind
instances.

Change-Id: I707bc151dfc9dafe1017f839c90a2051e4310301
(cherry picked from commit 1123931f6d6c3f19675fd47b5137616cb82416e1)

commit_message:
Modify designate bind pool config to match proxied endpoints

The miniDNS servers are now proxied behind ports on the the
public network to allow integration with external DNS
services.

commit_message:
No deploy_kernel/ramdisk with the ramdisk deploy and no cleaning

Ramdisk deploys don't use IPA, no need to provide it. Cleaning may need
the agent, so only skip verification if cleaning is disabled.

Other boot interfaces may need fixing as well, I haven't checked them.

Change-Id: Ia2739311f065e19ba539fe3df7268075d6075787
(cherry picked from commit 65583e64172a0188d125117d1f2288e105832395)

commit_message:
Allow configuring the base port of the mini DNS proxy endpoints

The miniDNS servers are proxied behind ports on the public API
network to allow integration with the external DNS instances.
This patch introduces a heat parameter to allow tweaking the
base port. Note that it is not expected that this be necessary.
Conflicts:
  deployment/designate/designate-mdns-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/848733

Change-Id: I3e4d8d23ed6a1a6b421a3d2630210f08c5bdb9c2
(cherry picked from commit da28eef8ad14b14d83d330a8adc9e579ffb294f5)

commit_message:
[collectd] Remove processes plugin from default list

Remove the processes plugin from the default collectd plugins list as it
can cause logging to be flooded with messages such as 'procs_running not
found'.

Change-Id: I740a87bdf9ce9fccc34e661c48053ac8c969b5db
Signed-off-by: Leif Madsen <lmadsen@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91ee65408e6f4eb70338b42bc7c3791272c14dbd)

commit_message:
Run package check for openstack-selinux in privileged mode

rpm -V command needs to be run as root for some packages.
The current script fails with openstack-selinux package, which is included in tripleo_bootstrap_packages_bootstrap.

commit_message:
Remove _create_subnet & create_networks methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Replaced methods:
	* _create_subnet
	* create_networks (not used)

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

subject: zuul: Put Centos9 Stream job periodic-weekly and experimental
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 08:03:50.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "zuul: Put Centos9 Stream job periodic-weekly and experimental

This patch is a followup on 45c0a3884b6b4c0b9a6b1b3cef47651f5504502e

As agreed on the Nova weekly meeting [1], we won't put back C9S job to voting
and we'll rather put it on both experimental and periodic-weekly pipelines.
In order to insure we will monitor the status of those runs, we'll check
the status of the job during every Nova meeting happening weekly.

In order to trigger potential race conditions, it was acted to provide an
experimental job for C9S too.

[1] https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/nova/2022/nova.2022-07-05-16.00.log.html#l-52

Change-Id: I2de4d90202fd7e735026150f79409d51f2d70e0e
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: Put Centos9 Stream job periodic-weekly and experimental

This patch is a followup on 45c0a3884b6b4c0b9a6b1b3cef47651f5504502e

As agreed on the Nova weekly meeting [1], we won't put back C9S job to voting
and we'll rather put it on both experimental and periodic-weekly pipelines.
In order to insure we will monitor the status of those runs, we'll check
the status of the job during every Nova meeting happening weekly.

In order to trigger potential race conditions, it was acted to provide an
experimental job for C9S too.

[1] https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/nova/2022/nova.2022-07-05-16.00.log.html#l-52

Change-Id: I2de4d90202fd7e735026150f79409d51f2d70e0e

commit_message:
WIP: conductor worker mode

A basic idea of what it might look like to provide a
worker mode flag to help short cirucit some of the
conductor logic and allow an operator to run with greater
CPU concurrency by beginning to split apart the ironic
conductor process.

This should kind of serve as a first conceptual idea of
what we could do in an iterrative fashion to improve
locking and concurrency.

Change-Id: I60be5b09b0c91cc4c03e2e2b4deb1645e352eaac

subject: ubuntu: more exact match on squashfs file, containerfile: use focal
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-11 09:58:58.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/ubuntu/root.d/10-cache-ubuntu-tarball', '.zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'ubuntu: more exact match on squashfs file, containerfile: use focal

This is a squash of two changes that have unfortunately simultaneously
broken the gate.

The functests are failing with

 sha256sum: bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs.manifest: No such file or directory

I think what has happened here is that the SHA256 sums file being used
has got a new entry "bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs.manifest"
which is showing up in a grep for
"bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs".  sha256 then tries to also
check this hash, and has started failing.

To avoid this, add an EOL marker to the grep so it only matches the
exact filename.

Change I7fb585bc5ccc52803eea107e76dddf5e9fde8646 updated the
containerfile tests to Jammy and it seems that cgroups v2 prevents
podman running inside docker [1].  While we investigate, move this
testing back to focal.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/14884
Change-Id: I1af9f5599168aadc1e7fcdfae281935e6211a597
'}]
commit_message:
ubuntu: more exact match on squashfs file, containerfile: use focal

This is a squash of two changes that have unfortunately simultaneously
broken the gate.

The functests are failing with

 sha256sum: bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs.manifest: No such file or directory

I think what has happened here is that the SHA256 sums file being used
has got a new entry "bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs.manifest"
which is showing up in a grep for
"bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs".  sha256 then tries to also
check this hash, and has started failing.

To avoid this, add an EOL marker to the grep so it only matches the
exact filename.

Change I7fb585bc5ccc52803eea107e76dddf5e9fde8646 updated the
containerfile tests to Jammy and it seems that cgroups v2 prevents
podman running inside docker [1].  While we investigate, move this
testing back to focal.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/14884
Change-Id: I1af9f5599168aadc1e7fcdfae281935e6211a597
